longitudo: <entryFree id="n26963" type="main" key="longi^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">longĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>longus</etym>, <sense id="n26963.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">length</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26963.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hac immensitate latitudinum, longitudinum, altitudinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:20:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 20, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itineris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 9, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longitudines et brevitates in sonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:51:173" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 51, 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diffindere aliquid in longitudinem,</quote> <trans><tr>lengthwise</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in longitudinem murum praeduxerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longitudinis pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:42" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:118" default="NO">11, 3, 118</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 34, 62, § 150</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hispania ulterior in duas per longitudinem provincias dividitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 1, 2, § 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26963.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of time, <hi rend="ital">length, long duration</hi> (rare; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">longinquitas, diuturnitas): noctis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:10:section=26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 10, § 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. 17, 59</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">prooemii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:62" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulere in longitudinem,</quote> <trans><tr>to look far ahead, take thought for the future</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 2, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
longiturnitas: <entryFree id="n26964" type="main" key="longi^turni^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">longĭturnĭtas</orth>, ātis. <gen>f.</gen> <etym>longiturnus</etym>, <sense id="n26964.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">duration</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Baruch. 3, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> de Amic. 57</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
longiturnus: <entryFree id="n26965" type="main" key="longi^turnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">longĭturnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>longus</etym>, <sense id="n26965.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">long, of long duration</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Baruch. 4, 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
longiuscule: <entryFree id="n26966" type="main" key="longi^uscu^le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">longĭuscŭlē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. longiusculus <sense id="n26966.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
longiusculus: <entryFree id="n26967" type="main" key="longi^uscu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">longĭuscŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n26967.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [longior, -ius], <hi rend="ital">rather long</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 10, 25</bibl></cit>.—Hence, * <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">longĭ-uscŭlē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">rather far</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">progredi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
longivivax: <entryFree id="n26968" type="hapax" key="longi^vi_vax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">longĭvīvax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>longus-vivax</etym>, <sense id="n26968.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">long-lived</hi>, Vet. Schol. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:251" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 251</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
longobardi: <entryFree id="n26969" type="main" key="Longo^bardi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Longŏbardi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, v. Langobardi.</entryFree>
longula: <entryFree id="n26970" type="main" key="Longu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Longŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n26970.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Volscian city in the neighborhood of Corioli</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:39" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 39</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n26970.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Longŭlāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Longula, Longulans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 69</bibl> (al. Longani).</sense></entryFree>
longule: <entryFree id="n26971" type="main" key="longu^le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">longŭlē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. longulus <sense id="n26971.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
longulus: <entryFree id="n26972" type="main" key="longu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">longŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n26972.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [longus], <hi rend="ital">rather long</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 13</bibl></cit>, a.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">longŭlē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">rather far</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud longule ex hoc loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 5, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:prol. 64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. prol. 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 224</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
longum: <entryFree id="n26973" type="main" key="longum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">longum</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. longus <sense id="n26973.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> C.</sense></entryFree>
longuntica: <entryFree id="n26974" type="main" key="Longunti^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Longuntĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n26974.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:20:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 20, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
longurio: <entryFree id="n26975" type="hapax" key="longu^ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">longŭrĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>longus</etym>, <sense id="n26975.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tall fellow, a long-shanks</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 131, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
longurius: <entryFree id="n26976" type="main" key="longu^ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">longŭrĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26976.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a long pole</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter singulas equas a praesepibus intericere longurios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:1:14:2" default="NO">1, 14, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">falces praeacutae insertae affixaeque longuriis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
longus: <entryFree id="n26977" type="main" key="longus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">longus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cf. <foreign lang="greek">lagga/zw, logga/zw</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n26977.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">long.</hi> </sense><sense id="n26977.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26977.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">longo interjecto intervallo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:9:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 9, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longissima epistula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rhenus longo spatio citatus fertur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proficisci longissimo agmine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stant longis annixi hastis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 229</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbilicus septem pedes longus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 34, 39, § 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longa folia habet fere ad tres digitos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 12, 86, § 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum autem tres longum habebat pedes,</quote> <trans><tr>in length</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scrobes faciemus tribus pedibus longas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 2, 10</bibl></cit>: longa navis, <hi rend="ital">a war-ship, manof-war</hi>, on account of its shape, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 11, 326</bibl> (Ann. v. 468 Vahl.); <pb n="1077" /> <cb n="LONG" /> Lentul. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 15, 5</bibl>: longus versus, <hi rend="ital">the heroic hexameter</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:27:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 27, 68</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 493</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 1, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">longa atque insignis honorum pagina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:57" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sesquipede est quam tu longior,</quote> <trans><tr>taller</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longus homo, i. q. longurio,</quote> <trans><tr>a tall fellow, long-shanks</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:67:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 67, 47</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Maura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:223" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 223</bibl></cit>: longa manus, <hi rend="ital">a long, far-reaching, mighty hand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">an nescis longas regibus esse manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 17, 166</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">on the contrary: attulimus longas in freta vestra manus,</quote> <trans><tr>unmutilated, uninjured</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:5:14" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 5, 14</bibl></cit> (4, 6, 60).—</sense><sense id="n26977.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">far off, remote, distant</hi>, = longinquus (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">remeans longis oris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:628" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 628</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longa a domo militia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 18, 1</bibl></cit>: longas terras peragrare, Auct. Decl. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:320" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 320</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26977.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Great, vast, spacious</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">pontus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 27, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Olympus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 223</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classemque ex aethere longo prospexit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:288" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 288</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 64</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26977.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of time, <hi rend="ital">long, of long duration</hi> or <hi rend="ital">continuance, tedious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tam longa aetate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 19, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita longior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:39:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 39, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horae quibus exspectabam longae videbantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uno die longior mensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:52:section=129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 52, § 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longa interjecta mora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post longum tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 7:17:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 7, 17, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:9:28:12" default="NO">9, 28, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per longum tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:57" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:40:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 40, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 17, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatium (sc. temporis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:18:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 18, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">error,</quote> <trans><tr>protracted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longi aliorum principatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longae pacis mala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:292" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 292</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:56" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriam nostri longam efficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:23:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 23, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">longo tempore,</quote> <trans><tr>after a long interval</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:309" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 309</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">longo post tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longa dies,</quote> <trans><tr>length of days, a long life</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:265" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 265</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longa syllaba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:47:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 47, 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">littera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:48:159" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 48, 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">syllabae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:36" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longae pretium virtutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:258" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 258</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longa Lethe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:769" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 769</bibl></cit>: in rebus apertissimis nimis longi sumus; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:27:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 27, 85</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exordium nimis longum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 7, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longior quam oportet sermo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:53" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla de morte hominis cunctatio longa est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:221" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 221</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantis longa senectus plena malis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:190" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 190</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:251" default="NO">14, 251</bibl>.—Hence: <cit><quote lang="la">longum est,</quote> <trans><tr>it would take long, it would be tedious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:60:section=156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 60, § 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longum est ea dicere, sed hoc breve dicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: experire; <cit><quote lang="la">non est longum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcessere tormenta longum videbatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 71</bibl></cit>. —Ellipt., without <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:8:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 8, 19</bibl>: ne longum sit, ne longum faciam, <hi rend="ital">not to be tedious, to speak briefly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ac, ne longum sit, Quirites, tabellas proferri jussimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ac ne longum fiat, videte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:10:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne longum faciam: dum tu quadrante lavatum Rex ibis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 137</bibl></cit>: longius facere, <hi rend="ital">to defer</hi> or <hi rend="ital">put off any longer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil opus est exemplis id facere longius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:6:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 6, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:7:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 7, 22</bibl>: nihil est mihi longius, <hi rend="ital">nothing makes time seem longer to me than</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">I am full of impatience, can hardly wait for</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">respondit, nihil sibi longius fuisse, quam ut me viderit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 27, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:18:section=39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 18, § 39</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">but: nec mihi longius quicquam est quam videre hominum voltus,</quote> <trans><tr>nothing is more tedious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 12, 35</bibl></cit>: in longum, <hi rend="ital">long, for a long time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec in longum dilata res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in longum dilata conclusio,</quote> <trans><tr>drawn out tediously</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causando nostros in longum ducis amores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">otium ejus rei haud in longum paravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in longum sufficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odia in longum jaciens, ia. A. 1, 69: nec in longius consultans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 95</bibl></cit>: per longum, <hi rend="ital">for a long time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">per longum celata fames,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:465" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 465</bibl></cit>: ex longo, <hi rend="ital">for a long time back</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">collecta fatigat edendi Ex longo rabies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 64</bibl></cit>: longa spes, <hi rend="ital">that looks far ahead, reaching far into futurity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae summa brevis spem nos vetat inchoare longam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 4, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:322" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 322</bibl>.—Of persons, <hi rend="ital">prolix, tedious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nolo esse longus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:36:101" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 36, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in verbis nimius et compositione nonnumquam longior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:118" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(testis) longus protrahi potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 7, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longus spe ( = tardus et difficilis ad sperandum),</quote> <trans><tr>slow to hope</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 172</bibl></cit>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>, in three forms. </sense><sense id="n26977.6" n="A" level="2"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">longē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">long, in length</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26977.7" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a long way off, far, far off, at a distance</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 95</bibl>: ab eo oppido non longe fanum<cb n="LOPA" />  est Junonis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:46:section=103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 46, § 103</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">longe absum, audio sero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam longe est hinc in saltum Gallicanum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 25, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longe mihi obviam processerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:27:section=65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 27, § 65</bibl></cit>: longe lateque collucere, <hi rend="ital">in length and breadth</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">far and wide, everywhere</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> N D. 2, 15, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Di vim suam longe lateque dmundunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:36:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 36, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longe gradi,</quote> <trans><tr>to take long steps</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:572" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 572</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vercingetorix locum castris delegit ab Avarico longe millia passuum XVI.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rhenum non longe a mari transire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu autem abes longe gentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 22, 2</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fontes longius a praesidiis aberant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:49:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 49, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longius non discedam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longius meare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:8:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 8, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26977.8" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26977.9" n="a" level="4"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">long, for a long period</hi> (but, acc. to some, not in positive; and the foll. passages are to be understood locally; v. Forbig. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:406" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 406</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 317</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">longe prospicere futuros casus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:12:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 12, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stupet Dares, longeque recusat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:406" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 406</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec longe,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 317</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae venientia longe ante videris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:14:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 14, 29</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Varro vitam Naevii producit longius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:15:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 15, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulo longius tolerare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:71:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 71, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longius anno remanere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 1, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 29:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 29, 1</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: quamdudum in portum venis huc? <hi rend="ital">Ep.</hi> Longissime, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 1, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid longissime meministi in patria tua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 9, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoad longissime potest mens mea respicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26977.10" n="b" level="4"> Of speech, <hi rend="ital">long, at length, diffusely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec dixi longius quam instituta ratio postulabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:48:162" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 48, 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longius aliquid circumducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 2, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26977.11" n="c" level="4"> Longe esse, abesse. </sense><sense id="n26977.12" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To be far away</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be of no assistance, of no avail</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">longe iis fraternum nomen populi Romani afuturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longe illi dea mater erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam tibi nunc longe regnum dotale Creusae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longe conjugia, ac longe Tyrios hymenaeos Inter Dardanias acies fore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:80" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 80</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 58</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26977.13" n="(b)" level="5"> Longe esse ab aliqua re, <hi rend="ital">to be far from</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">destitute of</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ab eloquentia longissime fuerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8</bibl></cit> prooem. § 3.—</sense><sense id="n26977.14" n="d" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Widely, greatly, much, very much, by far;</hi> esp. with <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> and (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug. = multo) <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">errat longe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longe ante videre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:19:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 19, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">longe melior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:556" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 556</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:28:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 28, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longe acrius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praestantior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:3:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 3, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:67" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumultuosior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:74" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelium longe magis prosperum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longe omnium longissima est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:8:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 8, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longe nobilissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longe doctissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longe plurimum ingenio valuisse videtur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:14:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 14, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longe princeps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longe praestare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:64:230" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 64, 230</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceteris antecellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:53:section=118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 53, § 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anteponere alicui rei aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:21:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 21, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dissentire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:9:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 9, 32 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod longe secus est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 29</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">longe aliter se habet ac,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 31, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longe dissimilis contentio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:17:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 17, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longe ante alias specie insignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sciunt longe aliud esse virgines rapere, aliud pugnare cum viris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:12:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 12, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longe mihi alia mens est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a quo mea longissime ratio ... abhorrebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:4:section=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 4, § 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longissime diversa ratio est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:18:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 18, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(istae facultates) longe sunt diversae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:49:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 49, 215</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longe omnes multumque superare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:44:section=115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 44, § 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longe et multum antecellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:13:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 13, 29</bibl></cit>.—Repeated: <cit><quote lang="la">plurimum et longe longeque plurimum tribuere honestati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:21:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 21, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed longe cunctis longeque potentior illa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:325" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 325</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26977.15" n="e" level="4"> In post-class. Lat. = valde: <cit><quote lang="la">longe gravis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:140" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longe opulentus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 112, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">par studiis aevique modis sed robore longe (sc. impar),</quote> <trans><tr>far from equal</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 176</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n26977.16" n="B" level="2"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">longĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">far</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non, ut opinor, id a leto jam longiter errat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:676" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 676</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26977.17" n="C" level="2"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">longum</orth>, <hi rend="ital">long, a long while</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">nimis longum loquor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis diu et longam loquor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec longum laetabere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:740" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 740</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:459" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 459</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:65" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:300" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 300</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 467</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lopadusa: <entryFree id="n26978" type="main" key="Lopadusa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lopadusa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n26978.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island on the coast of Africa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 7, 7, § 42</bibl>.—The same as <cb n="LOQU" /> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lepadusē</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 9, 15, § 92</bibl> Jan. (al. Lepidose).</sense></entryFree>
lopas: <entryFree id="n26979" type="main" key="lo^pas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏpas</orth>, v. lepas.</entryFree>
loquacitas: <entryFree id="n26980" type="main" key="lo^qua_ci^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏquācĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>loquax</etym>, <sense id="n26980.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">talkativeness, loquacity</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 4, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Macri loquacitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graeci alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:23:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 23, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo quaeque accuratius celantur, eo facilius loquacitate regiorum ministrorum emanant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:35:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 35, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in loquacitatem incidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:91" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inanem loquacitatem recidet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 5, 22</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">inanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 3, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 2, 17</bibl>.—Of birds: <cit><quote lang="la">expressior loquacitas picarum generi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 42, 59, § 110</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
loquaciter: <entryFree id="n26981" type="main" key="lo^qua_ci^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏquācĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. loquax <sense id="n26981.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
loquaculus: <entryFree id="n26982" type="hapax" key="lo^qua_cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏquācŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n26982.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [loquax], <hi rend="ital">somewhat loquacious</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1165</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
loquax: <entryFree id="n26983" type="main" key="lo^quax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏquax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>loquor</etym>, <sense id="n26983.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">talkative, prating, chattering, loquacious, full of words</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26983.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (ars) in excogitandis argumentis muta nimium est, in judicandis nimium loquax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:38:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 38, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senectus est naturā loquacior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 16, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo loquacissimus obmutuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 20, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loquacem esse de aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:23:22" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 23, 22</bibl></cit> (4, 25, 2).—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mendaciorum loquacissimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26983.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ranae,</quote> <trans><tr>croaking</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:431" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 431</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nidus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in which the young birds chatter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:475" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 475</bibl></cit>; cf.<cit><quote lang="la">, of young children: ipse (pater) loquaci gaudebit nido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:142" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stagna (on account of the frogs in them),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:458" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 458</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:21" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <trans><tr>expressive, speaking</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:7:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 7, 25</bibl></cit> (2, 6, 43): <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> Fragm. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lymphae,</quote> <trans><tr>murmuring, babbling</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:13:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 13, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:9:3" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 9, 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">avium loquaciores quae minores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:268" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 51, 112, § 268</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏquācĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">talkatively, loquaciously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loquaciter litigiosus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 12, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribetur tibi forma loquaciter et situs agri,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>at large, with all the particulars</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 4</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loquacius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Ep. 39, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
loquela: <entryFree id="n26984" type="main" key="lo^que_la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏquēla</orth> (incorrectly written <orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏquel-la</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26984.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">speech, language, words, discourse</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26984.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">commoda loquelam tuam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuditque has ore loquelas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:842" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 842</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nutricis blanda loquela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 230</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26984.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> * </sense><sense id="n26984.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A word</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc quidam loquelam dixerunt verbum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=57" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 57</bibl></cit> Müll.—* </sense><sense id="n26984.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A language</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graia loquela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:2:68" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 2, 68</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
loquelaris: <entryFree id="n26985" type="main" key="lo^que_la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏquēlāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>loquela</etym>, <sense id="n26985.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to speech</hi>: praepositiones loquelares, in the grammarians, <hi rend="ital">the inseparable prepositions</hi>, as re, se, dis, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0996,001:page=1427" default="NO"><author>Val. Prob.</author> p. 1427</bibl> P.: am praepositio loquelaris significat circum, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=4" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 4</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
loquentia: <entryFree id="n26986" type="main" key="lo^quenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏquentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>loquor</etym>, <sense id="n26986.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a talking, discoursing, readiness in speaking, fluency of speech</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">Julius Candidus non invenuste solet dicere, aliud esse eloquentiam, aliud loquentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 20, 5</bibl></cit>; satis loquentiae, sapientiae parum, Val. Prob. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:15:18" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 15, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
loquitor: <entryFree id="n26987" type="main" key="lo^qui^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏquĭtor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n26987.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. dep. n.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to speak much, talk</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loquitatusne es gnato meo male,</quote> <trans><tr>reviled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meditari condiscere, loquitari dediscere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 352, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
loquor: <entryFree id="n26988" type="main" key="lo^quor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏquor</orth>, <itype>cūtus</itype> (quūtus), lŏqui (<sense id="n26988.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> loquier, Naev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:24:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 24, 2</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [Sanscr. lap-, to talk, whisper; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">lak-, e)/lakon, la/skw</foreign>], <hi rend="ital">to speak, talk, say</hi> (in the lang. of common life, in the tone of conversation; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:45" default="NO">11, 3, 45</bibl>). </sense><sense id="n26988.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26988.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mitte male loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scipio mihi sane bene et loqui videtur et dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:58:212" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 58, 212</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:32:113" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 32, 113</bibl>: magistratum legem esse loquentem; <cit><quote lang="la">legem autem mutum magistratum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">male ... vere ac libere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:48:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 48, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum loquimur terni, nihil flagitii dicimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 22, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tu, Epicure? loquere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 39, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pure et Latine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:32:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 32, 144</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:4:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 4, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliud esse Latine, aliud grammatice loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Latine atque emendate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliā linguā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:14:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 14, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud aliquem,</quote> <trans><tr>before any one</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:22:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 22, 74</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">adversum aliquem,</quote> <trans><tr>before any one</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 205</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene de aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 2:9:63" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 2, 9, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secus de aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">male de aliquo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sirach, 8, 5</bibl></cit>; Capitol.<pb n="1078" /> <cb n="LORI" />  Alb. 2: <cit><quote lang="la">de me male,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:51" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 51 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> —</sense><sense id="n26988.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: male loqui alicui, <hi rend="ital">to speak evil of any one</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pergin male loqui, mulier, mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:26" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vento et fluctibus loqui,</quote> <trans><tr>to express vain wishes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:491" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 491</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26988.4" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque loqui possumus, nisi e syllabis brevibus ac longis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:61" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut non loqui et orare, sed fulgurare ac tonare videaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:16:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 16, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26988.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n26988.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To speak out, to say, tell, talk about, mention, utter, name</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loquere tuum mihi nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 9, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 1, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deliramenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 2, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas tu mulieres quos tu parasitos loquere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 2, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid tu in illum bene voles loqui, id loqui licebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adfirmat nihil a se cuiquam de te secus esse dictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:19:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 19, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horribile est, quae loquantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:7:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 7, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne singulas loquar urbes,</quote> <trans><tr>mention</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:54:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 54, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid turres loquar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ego legem loquar?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:11:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 11, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid loquar marmora, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:25" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem absentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:3:17" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 3, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26988.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To talk of, speak about, to have ever on one's lips</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dolabella merum bellum loquitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:13:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 13, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne semper Curios et Luscinos loquamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:6:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 6, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multi etiam Catilinam atque illa portenta loquebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:23:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 23, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil nisi classes loquens et exitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui de magnis majora loquuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:17" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26988.8" n="3" level="3"> Loquuntur, <hi rend="ital">they say, it is said, they talk of, the talk is of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic mera scelera loquuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 13, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:30:section=78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 30, § 78</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eodem die vulgo loquebantur Antonium mansurum esse Casilini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia magna loquens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare aliquem famae loquendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:25:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 25, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juppiter, hospitibus nam te dare jura loquuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:731" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 731</bibl></cit>: de damnatione ferventer loqui est coeptum, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26988.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n26988.10" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To speak, declare, show, indicate</hi> or <hi rend="ital">express clearly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi nimis arguti quemadmodum animo affecti simus, loquuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:9:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res loquitur ipsa, judices, quae semper valet plurimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:20:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 20, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ipsae res loquuntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> de Pud. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut fama loquitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:93:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 93, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum chartā dextra locuta est,</quote> <trans><tr>has written upon it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 18, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volucres mea fata loquentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:181" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 181</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:617" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 617</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rescriptum divi Marci sic loquitur, quasi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:14:10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 14, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26988.11" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to rustle, murmur</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pini loquentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 4, 11</bibl>: mollia discordi strepitu virgulta loquuntur, Petr. poët. Sat. 120, 73.</sense></entryFree>
lora: <entryFree id="n26989" type="main" key="lo^ra1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n26989.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thin wine made of the husks of grapes, after-wine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loram bibere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expressi acinorum folliculi in dolia coniciuntur, eoque aqua additur, ea vocatur lora, quod lota acina: ac pro vino operariis datur hieme,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:54" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 54 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 10, 12, § 86</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 551, 18</bibl>; cf. also lorea.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n26990" type="main" key="lo_ra2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lōra</orth>, v. lura.</entryFree>
loracina: <entryFree id="n26991" type="main" key="Loraci_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Loracīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n26991.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river near Antium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 4, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
loramentum: <entryFree id="n26992" type="main" key="lo_ra_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lōrāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>lorum</etym>, <sense id="n26992.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a thong</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">capita loramentorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:7:16" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladio loramenta caedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>—Also, <hi rend="ital">any fastening</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loramentum ligneum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,030:22:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccl. 22, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lorarius: <entryFree id="n26993" type="main" key="lo_ra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lōrārĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26993.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a harness-maker</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26993.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, Inscr. ap. Maff. Mus. Ver. 295, 3 (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4302</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n26993.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a flogger, chastiser</hi>, who scourged slaves with thongs: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (magistratus) dicebantur lorarii, et, quos erant jussi, vinciebant, aut verberabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:3:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 3, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
loratus: <entryFree id="n26994" type="hapax" key="lo_ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lōrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26994.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bound with thongs</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">juga,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Mor. 122</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lorea: <entryFree id="n26995" type="main" key="lo^re^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏrĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, for 1. lora, <sense id="n26995.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wine of the second press, after-wine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam adbibere aures meae tuae loream orationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 10</bibl></cit> Brix ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">erit lorea familiae, quod bibat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bibere solitus esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:23:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 23, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
loretum: <entryFree id="n26996" type="main" key="lo_re_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lōrētum</orth>, v. lauretum.</entryFree>
loreus: <entryFree id="n26997" type="main" key="lo_re^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lōrĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lorum</etym>, <sense id="n26997.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of thongs, made of thongs</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26997.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">funes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">63</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26997.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: ego vostra faciam latera lorea. <hi rend="ital">I will cut your hide into strips</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lorica: <entryFree id="n26998" type="main" key="lo_ri_ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lōrīca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26998.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a leather cuirass, a corselet of thongs</hi> (opp. thorax, a brazen breastplate). </sense><sense id="n26998.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro lorica malacum capiam pallium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 1</bibl></cit>, <cb n="LORU" /> 37: <cit><quote lang="la">lata insignisque lorica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:26:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 26, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambulat cum lorica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 17, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">graves loricis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trilix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:467" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 467</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 259</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:401" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 401</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bilix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:376" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 376</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">truncis affixa tropaeis lorica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:134" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum vix loricam multiplicem conixi umeris ferunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:4:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 4, 25</bibl></cit>.—Also of linen: <cit><quote lang="la">lintea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26998.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a defence</hi> of any kind. </sense><sense id="n26998.3" n="1" level="3"> Milit., <hi rend="ital">a breastwork, parapet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">turres contabulantur, pinnae loricaeque ex cratibus attexuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic vallo loricam pinnasque adjecit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loricam vallumque struxere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:4:30" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 4, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 4, 28</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n26998.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A fence, hedge, enclosure</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 186</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 24, 5, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26998.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A plastering, plaster</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lorica testacea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stellionis cubile est in loricis ostiorum, fenestrarumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 10, 27, § 89</bibl></cit>.— *</sense><sense id="n26998.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">libros Mutare loricis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to exchange studies for arms</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:29:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 29, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
loricarius: <entryFree id="n26999" type="main" key="lo_ri_ca_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lōrīcārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lorica</etym>, <sense id="n26999.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to cuirasses</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loricaria fabrica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26999.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: ‡<orth extent="full" lang="la">lōrīcārĭ-us</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">qwrakopoio/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a maker of cuirasses</hi>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
loricatio: <entryFree id="n27000" type="main" key="lo_ri_ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lōrīcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27000.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a clothing in armor, an arming;</hi> hence, transf., duplex, <hi rend="ital">a double flooring, double pavement</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 1</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">loricationes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Dig. 50, 16, 79 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
loricifer: <entryFree id="n27001" type="gloss" key="lo_ri_ci^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lōrīcĭfer</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">qwrakofo/ros</foreign> (<sense id="n27001.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cuirassier</hi>), Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
lorico: <entryFree id="n27002" type="main" key="lo_ri_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lōrīco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>lorica</etym>, <sense id="n27002.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to clothe in mail, to mail, to harness</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27002.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">statua loricata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites loricati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornatus loricatusque elephantus cum esset, ubi pluribus coriis se loricavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 24, 36, § 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(salmonis) loricatum pectus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Mos. 101</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27002.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic.: <cit><quote lang="la">AD LORICATA, perh. the title of the person intrusted with the care of the mailed statue of Cæsar in the Forum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2893</bibl></cit> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">A LORICATA,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2894</bibl></cit>).—*</sense><sense id="n27002.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to cover with plastering, to plaster</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:57" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 57</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">lōrĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., harnessed, clad in mail</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum loricatus in foro ambularet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
loricula: <entryFree id="n27003" type="main" key="lo_ri_cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lōrīcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27003.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small breastplate;</hi> hence, transf., <hi rend="ital">a small breastwork</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum frontes viminea loricula munirentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:9:3" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loricula urbem esse circumdatam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 4, 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
loriola: <entryFree id="n27004" type="hapax" key="lo^ri^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŏrĭŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>1. lora</etym>, <sense id="n27004.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wine of the second press, after-wine</hi>: loriolam nominabant, cum ex uvis expressum erat, et ad folliculos reliquos et vinacea adiciebant aquam, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 551, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
loripes: <entryFree id="n27005" type="main" key="lo_ri^pe_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lōrĭpēs</orth>, <itype>pĕdis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lorum-pes</etym>, <sense id="n27005.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">strapfooted</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">limber-footed, lithe-legged;</hi> acc. to others, <hi rend="ital">crook-footed, bandy-legged</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">proci loripedes, tardissimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loripedem rectus derideat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:23" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:308" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 308</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentem inter Nomadas Indos, anguium modo loripedem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 2, 2, § 25</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 8, 8, § 46</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 45, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lorum: <entryFree id="n27006" type="main" key="lo_rum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lōrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">lōrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 57, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 135, 13</bibl>; Schol. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:480" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 480</bibl>), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>for vlorum, from a ground-form vlārom; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">eu)/lhra</foreign>, reins; root perh. val-; cf. volvo</etym>, <sense id="n27006.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a thong</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27006.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vincire vis? en ostendo manus: tu habes lora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: vis subigit verum fateri; <cit><quote lang="la">ita lora laedunt brachia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">celsa lorum cervice ferentem,</quote> <trans><tr>a leash</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 213</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 40, 61, § 147</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sella loris intenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcano sacra ferens nutantia loro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:125" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 125</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27006.2" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">leather</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">signum de paupere loro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:165" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 165</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27006.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lōra</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the reins</hi> of a bridle: <cit><quote lang="la">loris ducere equos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lora dare,</quote> <trans><tr>to give the reins to the horses, slacken the reins</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lora tende,</quote> <trans><tr>draw the reins tight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 2, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortius uti loris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lora remisit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:200" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 200</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Automedon lora tenebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:61" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1,
