61</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n27006.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A whip, lash, scourge</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin loris caedite, si lubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 4, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">loris uri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loris caedere aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:88" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 88</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">loris rumpere aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:10:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 10, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:414" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 414</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27006.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The girdle of Venus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dixit et arcano percussit pectora loro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:21:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 21, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27006.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The leathern</hi> bulla, <hi rend="ital">worn by children of the poorer class</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:165" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 165</bibl>; v. bulla.—</sense><sense id="n27006.7" n="E" level="2"> = membrum virile, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:58:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 58, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:55:5" default="NO">10, 55, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27006.8" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A slender vinebranch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 1, 3, § 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27006.9" n="G" level="1"> Lorum vomitorium,<cb n="LUBR" />  <hi rend="ital">a thong thrust into the throat to produce vomiting</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 180" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 180</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
loryma: <entryFree id="n27007" type="main" key="Lo_ryma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lōryma</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ta\ *lw/ruma</foreign>, <sense id="n27007.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a seaport in Carta</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:10" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 28, 29, § 104</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lot: <entryFree id="n27008" type="main" key="Lo_t"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lōt</orth>, <gen>m.</gen> <itype>indecl.</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lw/t</foreign>, <sense id="n27008.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Lot, son of Haran, and nephew of Abraham</hi>, Prud. Psych. praef. 32; <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> 2, 405</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 11, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lotaster: <entryFree id="n27009" type="hapax" key="lo_taster"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lōtaster</orth>, <itype>tri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>lotos</etym>, <sense id="n27009.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the wild lotus, of which javelins were made</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 131</bibl> Wernsd.</sense></entryFree>
lotio: <entryFree id="n27010" type="main" key="lo_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lōtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>lavo</etym>, <sense id="n27010.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a washing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lotiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lotiolente: <entryFree id="n27011" type="main" key="lo_ti^o_lente_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lōtĭōlentē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>lotium</etym>, <sense id="n27011.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">foully, impurely</hi>, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 131, 32</bibl> (lotilente, v. 137 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
lotis: <entryFree id="n27012" type="main" key="Lo_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lōtis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lōtos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lwti/s, *lwto/s</foreign>, <sense id="n27012.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a nymph, daughter of Neptune, who was changed into the lotus-tree</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lotis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:347" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 347</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:415" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 415</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lotos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 2, 84</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lotium: <entryFree id="n27013" type="main" key="lo_ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lōtĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n27013.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">urine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">brassica alvum bonam facit lotiumque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 156</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 23</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">non valet lotium suum, of a good-for-nothing fellow,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 57, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lotometra: <entryFree id="n27014" type="greek" key="lo_to^me_tra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lōtŏmētra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lwtomh/tra</foreign>, <sense id="n27014.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a species of lotus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 21, 28, § 56</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lotophagi: <entryFree id="n27015" type="main" key="Lo_to^pha^gi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lōtŏphăgi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype> <etym><hi rend="ital">Gr. gen.</hi> Lotophagōn, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 4, 4, § 20</bibl></etym>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lwtofa/goi</foreign> (lotus-eaters), <sense id="n27015.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an African people on the Lesser Syrtis, to whom fable ascribes great hospitality</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:7:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 7, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 789</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 124</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:310" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 310</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 6, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lotophagitis: <entryFree id="n27016" type="greek" key="Lo_to^pha^gi_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lōtŏphăgītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lwtofagi=tis</foreign>, <sense id="n27016.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the island of the lotus-eaters</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 7, 7, § 41</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lotos: <entryFree id="n27017" type="greek" key="lo_tos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lōtos</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">lōtus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:51:14" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 51, 14</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">lwto/s</foreign>. <sense id="n27017.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of several plants</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27017.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The Egyptian water-lily</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 17, 32, § 104</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27017.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A tree on the northern coast of Africa, the food of the Lotophagi, the lotustree, edible nettle-tree</hi>, contrasted with the former of the same name, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 17, 32, § 101</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 84</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cul. 123</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n27017.3" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A tree of Italy, the Italian persimmon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 30, 53, § 121</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:235" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 44, 85, § 235</bibl> sq.— </sense><sense id="n27017.4" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The date-plum</hi> (faba Graeca), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 2, 2, § 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27017.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27017.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The fruit of the lotus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:12:27" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 12, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:10:18" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 10, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:311" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 311</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27017.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A flute</hi> (because made of lotus-wood): <cit><quote lang="la">horrendo lotos adunca sono,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:190" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 190</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:432" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 432</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lotura: <entryFree id="n27018" type="main" key="lo_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lōtūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>lavo</etym>, <sense id="n27018.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a washing, bathing</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">pompholyx loturā se paratur, spodos illota est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 13, 33, § 128</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:52" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lotus: <entryFree id="n27019" type="main" key="lo_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lōtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from lavo.</entryFree>
<entryFree id="n27020" type="main" key="lo_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lōtus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. lotos.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n27021" type="main" key="lo_tus3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lōtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>lavo</etym>, <sense id="n27021.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a washing, bathing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
loxias: <entryFree id="n27022" type="main" key="Loxi^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Loxĭas</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">*loci/as</foreign>, <sense id="n27022.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname of Apollo, on account of his obscure</hi> (<foreign lang="greek">locoi=s</foreign>) <hi rend="ital">oracles</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 17, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lua: <entryFree id="n27023" type="main" key="Lu^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lŭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>luo</etym>, also called Lua Mater and Lua Saturni, <sense id="n27023.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a goddess who expiated the blood shed in battle; to her were devoted the arms taken from an enemy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:33" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=36" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 36</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:23:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 23, 1</bibl>; Inscr. ap. Reinas. I. n. 238.</sense></entryFree>
lubens: <entryFree id="n27024" type="main" key="lu^bens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭbens</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">lŭbenter</orth>, v. libet <sense id="n27024.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
lubet: <entryFree id="n27025" type="main" key="lu^bet"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭbet</orth>, v. libet.</entryFree>
lubido: <entryFree id="n27026" type="main" key="lu^bi_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭbīdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, v. libido.</entryFree>
lubricitas: <entryFree id="n27027" type="main" key="lu_^bri^ci^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lū^brĭcĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>lubricus</etym>, <sense id="n27027.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">slipperiness</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> de Amic. 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lubrico: <entryFree id="n27028" type="main" key="lu_bri^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūbrĭco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>lubricus</etym>, <sense id="n27028.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make smooth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">slippery, to lubricate</hi> (postclass.). </sense><sense id="n27028.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui Lacedaemonium pytismate lubricat orbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:175" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lubricatus lapis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 22</bibl></cit>; Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 11, 38.— </sense><sense id="n27028.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To be slippery</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Thren. 4, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">limo caenoso ripae supercilio lubricante,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, 18</bibl></cit> (p. 481), 196, 3.—</sense><sense id="n27028.3" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lubricatus,</quote> <trans><tr>anointed</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 571</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lubricus: <entryFree id="n27029" type="main" key="lu_bri^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūbrĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">lito/s, lisso/s</foreign>, smooth; from root <foreign lang="greek">glit</foreign>; cf. <foreign lang="greek">gli/sxros</foreign>, glittus, and <foreign lang="greek">o)libro/s</foreign>, slippery</etym>, <sense id="n27029.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">slippery</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27029.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">loculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testudini injecta imbris in modum lubrico fastigio innoxia ad imum labebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 9, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">assiduo lubricus imbre lapis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:18:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 18, 2</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lūbrĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a slippery place</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in lubrico atque instabili fundamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 14, 21, § 95</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: equi lubrico paludum lapsantes, <hi rend="ital">on the slippery<pb n="1079" /> <cb n="LUCA" />  morass</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 65</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27029.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27029.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Slippery, smooth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:58:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 58, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27029.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">That easily slips, glides</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">moves away, slippery, slimy, lubricous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura lubricos oculos fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:57:142" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 57, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:14" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:6:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 6, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pisces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 20, 37, § 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conchylia,</quote> <trans><tr>slimy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 3, 3, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lubrica prensantes effugit umbra manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:476" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 476</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis,</quote> <trans><tr>gliding</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:6:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 6, 81</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27029.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27029.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Slippery, uncertain, hazardous, dangerous, critical</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">via vitae praeceps et lubrica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 42, 105</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">viae lubricae adulescentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:17:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 17, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetas puerilis maxime lubrica atque incerta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:52:section=137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 52, § 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupiditas dominandi praeceps et lubrica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:18:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 18, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lubrica defensionis ratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">observatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:8:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 8, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">geometriam dico ... et si qua alia propter subtilitatem lubrica sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:5:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus nimium lubricus aspici,</quote> <trans><tr>seductive</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:19:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 19, 8</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lūbrĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a slippery</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hazardous state, period</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">season</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in lubrico versari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:28:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 28, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lubricum aetatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lubricum linguae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:4:7:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 4, 7, § 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27029.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Gliding, fleeting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">historia lubrica est hac atque illac fluit, ut homines, qui manibus invicem adprehensis gradum firmant, continent et continentur,</quote> <trans><tr>passing from one subject to another</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:129" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annus,</quote> <trans><tr>fleeting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:364" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 364</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n27029.8" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Slippery, deceitful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nequiquam patrias tentasti lubricus artes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:716" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 716</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27029.9" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Prone, inclined, ready</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flore capi juvenum lubrica mentem nympha,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:18" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 18</bibl></cit>: aetas ad vitium, Ambros. de Interp. Job et Dav. 1, 7, 21.—</sense><sense id="n27029.10" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Unsteady, unsettled, easily going astray</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si qua in parte lubricum adulescentiae nostrae declinat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lubricam principis aetatem retinere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
luca: <entryFree id="n27030" type="main" key="Lu_ca1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lūca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n27030.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Etruria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Lucca</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:59:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 59, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:17" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 3:2" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 3, 2</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n27030.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lū-censis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of Lucca</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">municipium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n27031" type="main" key="Lu_ca2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lūca</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lūcas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n27031.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Lucanian;</hi> v. Lucani, D.</sense></entryFree>
lucagus: <entryFree id="n27032" type="main" key="Lu_ca^gu^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lūcăgŭs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n27032.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a warrior</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:575" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 575</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lucani: <entryFree id="n27033" type="main" key="Lu_ca_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lūcāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n27033.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in Lower Italy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=39" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 39</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 19</bibl> and 25; 9, 20 et saep.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the territory inhabited by them</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:17:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 17, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:180" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 180</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n27033.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lū-cānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Lucanian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 5, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 10, § 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pascua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:1:28" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:2:85" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 2, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:25" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 24</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lūcānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a surname of the poet</hi> M. Annaeus, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> Corduba, <hi rend="ital">nephew of Seneca the philosopher, and author of the poem</hi> Pharsalia. <hi rend="ital">He was condemned to death by Nero for participating in the conspiracy of Piso</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:90" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:62:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 62, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:194" default="NO">14, 194</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:36" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:79" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 79</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27033.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lūcānĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the district of Lucania, in Lower Italy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:9" default="NO">9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:37:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 37, 89</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27033.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lūcānĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">Lucanian;</hi> only as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lūcānĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of meat sausage invented by the Lucanians</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">solebam antea delectari oleis et lucanicis tuis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:35" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:9:35" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 9, 35</bibl>. Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">lūcānĭcum</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">lūcānĭcus</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 73</bibl> P.; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">lūcā-na</orth>, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=111" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 111</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n27033.4" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lūca bōs</orth>, <hi rend="ital">Lucanian cow</hi>, for <hi rend="ital">elephant</hi> (because the Romans first saw this animal in Lucania, in the army of Pyrrhus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:389:section=39" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, 389, § 39</bibl> Müll.; Enn. ib.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1302" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1302</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1339" default="NO" valid="yes">1339</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:573" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 573</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 15, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 6, 6, § 16</bibl>.—Prov.: prius pariet locusta Lucam bovem, <hi rend="ital">of an impossible thing</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lucar: <entryFree id="n27034" type="main" key="lu_car"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūcar</orth>, <itype>āris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>lucus</etym>, <sense id="n27034.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a forest-tax for the support of players</hi>: lucar appellatur aes, quod ex lucis captatur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=119" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 119</bibl> Müll. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> cf.: lucaris pecunia, quae in luco erat data, ib.: lucar <foreign lang="greek">qeatriko\n a)rgu/rion misqo\s a)po\ fi/skou</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.: lucar vectigal, erogatio quae fiebat in lucis, Gloss. Isid.: de modo lucaris multa decernuntur,<cb n="LUCE" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 77</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3882</bibl>: (Johannes) contumeliosā caede truncatur in puellae salticae lucar (<hi rend="ital">the reward of a dancing-girl</hi>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Gnost. 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lucaris: <entryFree id="n27035" type="main" key="lu_ca_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūcāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lucus</etym>, <sense id="n27035.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a grove</hi>: lucaris pecunia, quae in luco erat data, <hi rend="ital">forest-tax</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=119:6" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 119, 6</bibl> Müll.; v. lucar.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lūcāria</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the grove-festival</hi>: lucaria festa in luco colebant Romani, qui permagnus inter viam Salariam et Tiberim fuit, pro eo, quod victi a Gallis fugientes e proelio ibi se occultaverint, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=119" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 119</bibl> Müll.; Calend. Maff. in <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2, p. 394</bibl>; cf. Calend. Amitern. ib.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: eam noctem deincepsque insequentem diem, qui est Lucarium, Masur. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 4, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lucarium: <entryFree id="n27036" type="main" key="Lu_ca_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lūcārĭum</orth>, v. lucaris <sense id="n27036.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
lucas: <entryFree id="n27037" type="main" key="Lu_ca_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lūcās</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*louka=s</foreign>, <sense id="n27037.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">St. Luke, the third evangelist</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Col. 4, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 1002</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
lucabos: <entryFree id="n27038" type="main" key="Lu_ca bos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lūca bos</orth>, v. Lucani, D.</entryFree>
lucceius: <entryFree id="n27039" type="main" key="Lucce_i^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Luccēĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n27039.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman name</hi>. So esp., </sense><sense id="n27039.1" n="1" level="3"> Q. Lucceius, <hi rend="ital">of Rhegium, a witness against Verres</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:64:section=165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 64, § 165</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n27039.2" n="2" level="3"> L. Lucceius, <hi rend="ital">son of Marcus, a friend and correspondent of Cicero, and a supporter of the aristocracy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 21, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 20, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 1, 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27039.3" n="3" level="3"> L. Lucceius, <hi rend="ital">son of Quintus, an historical writer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 5, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 17, 11</bibl> saep.—</sense><sense id="n27039.4" n="4" level="3"> P. Lucceius, <hi rend="ital">a friend of Cicero, recommended by him to Cornificius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:25:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 25, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 30, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
luce: <entryFree id="n27040" type="main" key="lu_ce^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūcĕ</orth>, <sense id="n27040.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. adv., by day</hi>, etc.; v. lux, I. 2. b.</sense></entryFree>
luceium: <entryFree id="n27041" type="main" key="Luceium"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Luceium</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n27041.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a castle</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fortress in Galatia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:chapter=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lucellum: <entryFree id="n27042" type="main" key="lu^cellum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭcellum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>lucrum</etym>, <sense id="n27042.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small gain, slight profit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucelli aliquid dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:30:section=72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 30, § 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere aliquid lucelli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 44</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">106: tecum partita lucellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 82</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">trop.: hujus diei lucellum tecum communico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 5:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 5, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lucens: <entryFree id="n27043" type="main" key="lu_cens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūcens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from luceo.</entryFree>
lucensis: <entryFree id="n27044" type="main" key="Lu_censis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lūcensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. 1. Luca, II.</entryFree>
luceo: <entryFree id="n27045" type="main" key="lu_ce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūcĕo</orth>, <itype>xi, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. ruk, to be bright; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">lu/xnos, leuko/s, a)mfilu/kh</foreign>; Lat. lux, lumen, lucidus, luna; O. H.-Germ. liŏht; Germ. Licht; cf. also illustris</etym>, <sense id="n27045.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be light</hi> or <hi rend="ital">clear, to shine, beam, glitter</hi> (syn.: splendeo, fulgeo). </sense><sense id="n27045.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: (lumen) Nihilo minus ipsi lucet, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:16:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 16, 51</bibl> (Trag. v. 389 Vahl.): tum candida lumina lucent, id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=228" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 228</bibl> and 229 Müll. (Ann. v. 157 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">(stella) luce lucebat aliena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:4:16:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 4, 16, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum meus assiduo luceat igne focus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:6" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucet igne rogus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:11:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 11, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rara per occultos lucebat semita calles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:383" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 383</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucet via longo Ordine flammarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 143</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:14" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 14</bibl> (3, 6), 17: <cit><quote lang="la">interior caeli qua semita lucet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:641" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 641</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(luminaria) lucent in firmamento caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">niveo lucet in ore rubor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucent oculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 1, 239</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:492" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 492</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cinis in multam noctem pertinaciter luxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:74" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgatis lucent sagulis (sc. Galli),</quote> <trans><tr>glitter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:660" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 660</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taedā lucebis in illa,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>shall burn</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:155" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non amplius erit sol ad lucendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:60:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 60, 19</bibl></cit>.—In the <hi rend="ital">part. pres.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">e rosea sol alte lampade lucens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:610" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 610</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">globus lunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:725" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 725</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:270" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 270</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedebat In solio Phoebus claris lucente smaragdis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucerna lucens in caliginoso loco,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 2</bibl></cit> Pet. 1, 19.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic lucebis novae nuptae facem,</quote> <trans><tr>will light her home with a torch</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 1, 30</bibl></cit>: tute tibi puer es; <cit><quote lang="la">lautus luces cereum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27045.2" n="2" level="3"> Of the day, daylight, etc., <hi rend="ital">to appear, dawn, become light</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">an umquam lucebit in orbe ille dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:91" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucente jam die,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 15, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27045.3" n="(b)" level="5"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">impers.</hi>: lucet, lucebat, etc., <hi rend="ital">it is (was) light, it is (was) day, it is dawning</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">priusquam lucet, adsunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si lucet lucet: lucet autem, lucet igitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 30, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si judicatum erit meridie non lucere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nondum lucebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:34:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 34, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec satis lucebat: cum autem luceret, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 13</bibl></cit>, a, 1: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi lucere coepisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:23:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 23, 47</bibl></cit>: expergiscere: lucet hoc, <hi rend="ital">it is light, it is day there</hi> (in the sky), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc ... luce lucebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 26</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n27045.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to shine</hi> or <hi rend="ital">show through</hi>, <cb n="LUCE" /> <hi rend="ital">to be discernible, visible</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">si qua Arabio lucet bombyce puella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:2:25" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 2, 25</bibl></cit> (2, 3, 15): <cit><quote lang="la">femineum lucet sic per bombycina corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:68:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 68, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitalia lucent,</quote> <trans><tr>are uncovered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:525" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 525</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27045.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to shine forth, to be conspicuous, apparent, clear, evident</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc imperii nostri splendor illis gentibus lucet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:14:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 14, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mea officia et studia, quae parum antea luxerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 15, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum res ipsa tot, tam claris argumentis luceat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:23:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 23, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus lucet in tenebris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:28:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 28, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tota oratio lucet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:19" default="NO">9, 1, 19</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">lūcens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., shining, bright, conspicuous</hi>: lucentior usus, Mall. Theod. de Metr. 9, 7.</sense></entryFree>
luceres: <entryFree id="n27046" type="main" key="Lu_^ce^res"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lū^cĕres</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lū^cĕrenses</orth>, or perh. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lūcĕrēses</orth>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=119:10" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 119, 10</bibl>), <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n27046.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Etruscan tribe, whose union with the</hi> Ramnes <hi rend="ital">(Latins) and</hi> Taties <hi rend="ital">(Sabines) gave rise to the oldest Roman state. Romulus named after them one of his three centuries of horsemen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Luceres, ut Junius, a Lucumone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5</bibl></cit>, §§ 55 and 81 Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:8:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 8, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 20, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:13:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 13, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:36:2" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 36, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 1, 31; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:131" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 131</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc Taties Ramnesque viri Lŭceresque coloni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 1, 31.</sense></entryFree>
luceria: <entryFree id="n27047" type="main" key="Lu_ce^ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lūcĕrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n27047.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ancient city of Apulia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Lucera</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 15, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 12, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 11</bibl>, a; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:69:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 69, 197</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:15:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 15, 14</bibl> et saep.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n27047.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lū-cĕrīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Lucerian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">finis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 35</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lūcĕrīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Luceria, Lucerians</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lucerini ac Samnites ad internecionem caesi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lucerna: <entryFree id="n27048" type="main" key="lu^cerna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭcerna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>luc-erna, from luceo, q. v.; with double suffix like caverna, laverna, lanterna, etc.; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ke/-arnon, ske/parnon</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n27048.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lamp, oil-lamp</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27048.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: lucerna dicta a luce, aut quod id vocant Graeci <foreign lang="greek">lu/xnon</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=119" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 119</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">lucernam forte oblitus fueram extinguere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 2, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in sole lucernam adhibere nihil interest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:12:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 12, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucerna me deserit,</quote> <trans><tr>my light goes out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vino et lucernis Medus acinaces Immane quantum discrepat,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>evening entertainments</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:27:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 27, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accedit numerus lucernis,</quote> <trans><tr>the lights begin to seem double</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 1, 25</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum geminis exsurgit mensa lucernis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:305" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 305</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pereundum est ante lucernas,</quote> <trans><tr>before candle-light</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:339" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 339</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucernam accendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 19, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turpis fumo lucernae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:131" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucerna ardens exstinguitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 3, 28, § 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fungi lucernarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 11, 46, § 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinguem nebulam vomuere lucernae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:181" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucerna splendens super candelabrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sir. 26, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27048.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27048.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Nocturnal labor, lucubration</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">haec ego non credam Venusina digna Lucerna?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:51" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 51</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27048.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A guide, instructor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia mandatum lucerna est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 6, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2</bibl> Sam. 2, 29: <cit><quote lang="la">lucerna pedibus meis verbum tuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:118:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Psa. 118, 105</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27048.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A phosphorescent fish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 27, 43, § 82</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lucernaria: <entryFree id="n27049" type="main" key="lu^cerna_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭcernārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n27049.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the plant</hi> verbascum (acc. to Adelung's Lex. Manuale), <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lucernaris: <entryFree id="n27050" type="main" key="lu^cerna_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭcernāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lucerna</etym>, <sense id="n27050.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a lamp</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba,</quote> <trans><tr>candle-grass</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 17, 9, 73</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lucernarium: <entryFree id="n27051" type="main" key="lu^cerna_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭcernārĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27051.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the time when the lamps are lighted, candle-light</hi>, Aug. ap. Reg. Cleric.—</sense><sense id="n27051.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A lamp</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 9, 38 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
lucernarius: <entryFree id="n27052" type="gloss" key="lu^cerna_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭcernārĭus</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">luxnou=xos</foreign>, <sense id="n27052.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lampstand</hi>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
lucernatus: <entryFree id="n27053" type="main" key="lu^cerna_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭcernātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lucerna</etym>, <sense id="n27053.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">furnished</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">lighted with a lamp</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">janua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Uxor. 2, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lucernula: <entryFree id="n27054" type="main" key="lu^cernu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭcernŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27054.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small lamp</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">accensa lucernula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 107</bibl></cit>, n. 9; 117, n. 12.</sense></entryFree>
lucesco: <entryFree id="n27055" type="main" key="lu_cesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūcesco</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">lūcisco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n27055.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [luceo], <hi rend="ital">to begin to shine</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27055.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27055.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">sol lucescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 37</bibl></cit>: quorum caput flavo capillorum crine lucescat, Firm. Math. 4, 13.—</sense><sense id="n27055.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., of the break of day, <hi rend="ital">to grow light, break, dawn</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonae lucescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:417" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 417</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27055.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: lucescit or luciscit, <hi rend="ital">the day is breaking</hi>: eamus, Amphitruo: luciscit hoc jam, <hi rend="ital">it is getting light there</hi> (in the sky), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 3, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 1</bibl>; v. luceo, I. A. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: cum <pb n="1080" /> <cb n="LUCI" /> lucisceret, <hi rend="ital">as soon as it grew light, at break of day</hi>, *<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 4, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et jam lucescebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27055.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">luciscens amor,</quote> <trans><tr>bright</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:ad Anton. 1:5" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> ad Anton. 1, 5</bibl></cit> Mai.</sense></entryFree>
lucet: <entryFree id="n27056" type="main" key="lu_cet"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūcet</orth>, <sense id="n27056.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. impers.</hi>, v. luceo, I. A. 2. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>.</sense></entryFree>
lucetius: <entryFree id="n27057" type="main" key="Lu_ce^ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lūcĕtĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lūcĕtĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>lux</etym>, <sense id="n27057.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">light-bringer, a surname of Jupiter and of Juno</hi>: Lucetium Jovem appellat, Naev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:12:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 12, 6</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 9, 570</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 15</bibl>; cf. also: Lucetium Jovem appellabant, quod eum lucis esse causam credebant, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=114" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 114</bibl> Müll.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of Juno: Juno pulchra, sive te Lucinam, quod lucem nascentibus tribuas, ac Lucetiam convenit nuncupari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 149</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
luci: <entryFree id="n27058" type="main" key="lu_ci_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūcī</orth>, <case>abl.</case> as <pos>adv.</pos>, v. lux <sense id="n27058.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi> and I. 2. b.</sense></entryFree>
lucibilis: <entryFree id="n27059" type="gloss" key="lu_ci^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūcĭbĭlis</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">fwteino/s</foreign>, <sense id="n27059.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bright, clear</hi>, Gloss. Philox.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">luceus est, quod aliunde illuminatur, lucibile, quod per se patet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 6, 725</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lucide: <entryFree id="n27060" type="main" key="lu_ci^de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūcĭdē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. lucidus <sense id="n27060.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
lucidus: <entryFree id="n27061" type="main" key="lu_ci^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūcĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lux</etym>, <sense id="n27061.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">containing light, full of light, clear, bright, shining</hi> (syn.: luminosus, luculentus; as an <pos>adj.</pos> not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n27061.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aër,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:315" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 315</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:60" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concha,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:4:30" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 4, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucidior domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:94" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucidissima stella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:3:200" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 3, 200</bibl></cit> (Queck, dulcia): <cit><quote lang="la">quid lucidius sole?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sir. 17, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27061.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">brilliant, bright, beautiful, transparent, shining, white</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">Alcyone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:19:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 19, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ovis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:62" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedes deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 9, 35, § 59</bibl></cit> (better tralucido).—</sense><sense id="n27061.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27061.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Full of light</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of truth and purity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">totum corpus tuum lucidum erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:11:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 11, 34</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n27061.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Clear, perspicuous, luminous, lucid</hi> (of speech, or of orators; a favorite expression with Quintilian); <cit><quote lang="la">neque refert, an pro lucida (narratione) perspicuam dicamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propositio aperta et lucida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:5:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 5, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manifesta et lucida ratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:5:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 41</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res lucidior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:4:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 4, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:83" default="NO">4, 2, 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:5:1" default="NO">4, 5, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 3, 8: lucidior via,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:11:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 11, 23</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of orators, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucidior auctor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 74</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lūcĭdē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n27061.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Clearly, plainly, distinctly</hi> (mostly of speech): lucide verbum definire, *<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:25:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 25, 108</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucide dicentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo lucidius intellegi possit haec exceptio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:4:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 44, 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic ostendit lucidissime causam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:5:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 5, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27061.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Gloriously</hi> (see lucidus, B.): <cit><quote lang="la">lucidius tranquilliusque inter divina mansurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 71:16" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 71, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lucifer: <entryFree id="n27062" type="main" key="lu_ci^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūcĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lux-fero</etym>, <sense id="n27062.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">light-bringing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque ut apud Graecos Dianam, eamque Luciferam, sic apud nostros Junonem Lucinam in pariendo invocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:27:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 27, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars Lunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:726" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 726</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi,</quote> <trans><tr>the horses of Luna</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:11:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 11, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of Lucina</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:20:192" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 20, 192</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">bringing safety</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 625</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n27062.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lūcĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n27062.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The morning-star, the planet Venus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stella Lucifer interdiu, noctu Hesperus ita circumeunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:17" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 17</bibl></cit>: stella Veneris, quae <foreign lang="greek">*fwsfo/ros</foreign> Graece, Latine dicitur Lucifer, cum antegreditur solem, cum subsequitur autem Hesperos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:20:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 20, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si dormire incipis ortu Luciferi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:12" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:158" default="NO">13, 158</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 8, 6, § 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:10" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 10</bibl> (9), 62; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:3:71" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 3, 71</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27062.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The fabled son of Aurora and Cephalus, and father of Ceyx</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 2:42" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 2, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:271" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 271</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">346</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">acc. to others,</quote> <trans><tr>a son of Jupiter</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 4, 130</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27062.4" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> transf., <hi rend="ital">day</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">memento Venturum paucis me tibi Luciferis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:15" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 15</bibl></cit> (3, 12), 28: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:46" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:877" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 877</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lucifico: <entryFree id="n27063" type="hapax" key="lu_ci^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūcĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>lux-facio</etym>, <sense id="n27063.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make bright, to brighten</hi>: lucificare exitum alicujus aetati, Lab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
lucificus: <entryFree id="n27064" type="main" key="lu_ci^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūcĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27064.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">light-making, light-giving</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:9:45" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 9, 45</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lucifluus: <entryFree id="n27065" type="main" key="lu_ci^flu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūcĭflŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lux-fluo</etym>, <sense id="n27065.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lightstreaming, light-beaming, brilliant</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27065.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucifluus solis ortus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 3, 294</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27065.2" n="II" level="1"> Trop, <hi rend="ital">light-beaming, glorious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 4, 120</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lucifuga: <entryFree id="n27066" type="main" key="lu_ci^fu^ga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūcĭfŭga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>lux-fugio</etym>, <sense id="n27066.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lightfleeing, light-shunning</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27066.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: maritus, <cb n="LUCR" /> i. e. Cupid (who visited Psyche only at night), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 167, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mag. p. 284, 38</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27066.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">one who turns night into day</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">turba lucifugarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 122:15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 122, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lucifugax: <entryFree id="n27067" type="main" key="lu_ci^fu^gax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūcĭfŭgax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lux-fugax</etym>, <sense id="n27067.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lightshunning</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctua, Auct. Carm. Philomel. 40: natio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Min. Fel.</author> Octav. 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lucifugus: <entryFree id="n27068" type="main" key="lu_ci^fu^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūcĭfŭgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lux-fugio</etym>, <sense id="n27068.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">light-shunning</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27068.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">blattae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 243</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 12, 8, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27068.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: lucifugus, nebulo, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 19, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:18:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 18, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Min. Fel.</author> 8, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lucilius: <entryFree id="n27069" type="main" key="Lu_ci_li^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lūcīlĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n27069.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens, whose most celebrated members were, </sense><sense id="n27069.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The poet</hi> C. Lucilius, <hi rend="ital">a native of the Campanian Suessa, formerly Aurunca</hi> (hence, Auruncae alumnus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:19" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 19</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">the father of Roman satire</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:16:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 16, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:92" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 92</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis Lucilii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 169</bibl></cit> (alluding to the verse of Lucilius: vis est vita, vides, vis nos facere omnia cogit, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=63" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 63</bibl> Müll.); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:65" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 65</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27069.2" n="B" level="2"> Q. Lucilius Balbus, <hi rend="ital">an eminent Stoic</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:6:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 6, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:5:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 5, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 5, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27069.3" n="C" level="2"> Lucilius Bassus, <hi rend="ital">a writer of no merit</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 5</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n27069.4" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lūcĭlĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Lucilian, of the poet Lucilius</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">character,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 25, 61, § 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 12</bibl></cit>: fornix, prob. <hi rend="ital">a satire bearing this title</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lucina: <entryFree id="n27070" type="main" key="Lu_ci_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lūcīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. 1. lucinus.</entryFree>
lucinium: <entryFree id="n27071" type="gloss" key="lu_ci^ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūcĭnĭum</orth> = cicindela, <sense id="n27071.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a glowworm</hi>, Gloss. Vet.</sense></entryFree>
lucinus: <entryFree id="n27072" type="main" key="lu_ci_nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūcīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lux</etym>, <sense id="n27072.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lightbringing</hi>, or, <hi rend="ital">bringing to the light</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hora,</quote> <trans><tr>one's natal hour</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> adv. Symm. 2, 222</bibl></cit>. —Class. only <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lūcīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (lit., <pos>adj.</pos>; sc. dea). </sense><sense id="n27072.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The goddess of childbirth</hi> (because she brings to the light): <cit><quote lang="la">Juno Lucina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 7, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">date ignem in aram, ut venerem Lucinam meam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 5, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an facient mensem luces, Lucinaque ab illis Dicar?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:39" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:5:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 5, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:35:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 35, 13</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:27:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 27, 68</bibl>.— More freq. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nascenti puero Casta fave Lucina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si vocata partubus Lucina veris affuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:5" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:449" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 449</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27072.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> transf., <hi rend="ital">childbirth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lucinam pati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 60</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Lucinae experta labores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 340</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui rugis uterum Lucina notabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:785" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 785</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27072.3" n="II" level="1"> Of Hecate, as the producer of terrific dreams and nocturnal spectres: <cit><quote lang="la">efficiat vanos noctis Lucina timores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:13" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 13</bibl></cit> Dissen ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n27073" type="main" key="lu_ci_nus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūcīnus</orth>, i. q. lychnus, q. v.</entryFree>
luciparens: <entryFree id="n27074" type="main" key="lu_ci^pa^rens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūcĭpărens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lux-parens</etym>, <sense id="n27074.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">light-bearing, light-producing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox (because day follows it),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Phaen. 853</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lucipetus: <entryFree id="n27075" type="main" key="lu_ci^pe^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūcĭpĕtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lux-peto</etym>, <sense id="n27075.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">seeking light</hi> (opp. lucifigus): <cit><quote lang="la">musca,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 12, 8, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lucipor: <entryFree id="n27076" type="main" key="Lu_cipor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lūcipor</orth>, v. 1. Lucius, II.</entryFree>
lucisator: <entryFree id="n27077" type="main" key="lu_ci^sa^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūcĭsător</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>lux-sator</etym>, <sense id="n27077.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lightproducer, author of light</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucisator Omnipotens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 3, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lucisco: <entryFree id="n27078" type="main" key="lu_cisco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūcisco</orth>, v. lucesco.</entryFree>
lucius: <entryFree id="n27079" type="main" key="Lu_ci^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lūcĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>lux; of the day</etym>, <sense id="n27079.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman prænomen, usually represented by</hi> L.: <cit><quote lang="la">Crepusci, qui eo tempore erant nati, ut Lucii prima luce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L.
