L. 6, § 5</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui luci natus est Lucius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9</bibl></cit>, § 60 Müll.; and: Lucius praenomen est ejus, qui primum fuit, qui oriente luce natus est, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=119" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 119</bibl> Müll.—In <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lūcia</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=61" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 61</bibl> Müll.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n27079.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lucipor</orth> <itype>for Lucii puer</itype>, <hi rend="ital">the slave of a Lucius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 1, 6, § 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n27080" type="main" key="lu_ci^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūcĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n27080.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fish</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">the pike</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Mosell. 123</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lucomedi: <entryFree id="n27081" type="gloss" key="Lu^co^medi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lŭcŏmedi</orth>, v. lucumo, II. A.</entryFree>
lucomones: <entryFree id="n27082" type="gloss" key="Lu^co^mo_nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lŭcŏmōnes</orth>, v. lucumo, II. B.</entryFree>
lucratio: <entryFree id="n27083" type="main" key="lu_^cra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lū^crātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>lucror</etym>, <sense id="n27083.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gaining, gain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes lucrationis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Uxor. 2, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lucrativus: <entryFree id="n27084" type="main" key="lu_^cra_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lū^crātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27084.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gaining, attended with gain</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27084.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">gainful, profitable, lucrative</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">apricatio in illo lucrativo sole,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 11, 1</bibl></cit> B. and K.: <cit><quote lang="la">opera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 27</bibl></cit>; Spald. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucrativa in tantis negotiis tempora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:ad Anton. Ep. 2" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> ad Anton. Ep. 2</bibl></cit> Mai.: <cit><quote lang="la">potu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 2, § 72</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27084.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., in jurid. Lat.: res lucrativae, <hi rend="ital">things bequeathed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">given to</hi> a person (because the acquisition <cb n="LUCR" /> is pure gain, without payment), <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 11, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 10, 35, 1</bibl>: ex causa lucrativa habere (acquirere) aliquid, <hi rend="ital">to receive something by bequest</hi> or <hi rend="ital">as a gift</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:1:87" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 31, 1, 87</bibl> <hi rend="ital">pr.;</hi> 40, 1, 4: <cit><quote lang="la">ex causa lucrativa (fundus) meus factus est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 2, 17, 8</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">lucrativa possessio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:56" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:4:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 29, 4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucrativa usucapio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:60" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucrativa acquisitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:4:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 44, 4, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lucrator: <entryFree id="n27085" type="main" key="lu_^cra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lū^crātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>lucror</etym>, <sense id="n27085.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who gains, the acquirer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multarum gentium lucratores,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the apostles</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> in Psa. 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Comm. ad Tit. 1, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lucretia: <entryFree id="n27086" type="main" key="Lu_^cre_ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lū^crētĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Lucretius.</entryFree>
lucretilis: <entryFree id="n27087" type="main" key="Lu_^cre_ti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lū^crētĭlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n27087.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain in the Sabine territory</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Monte Genaro</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 17, 1</bibl>; cf.: Lucretilis mons in Sabinis, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=119" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 119</bibl> Müll.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lū^-crētīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">near the mountain</hi> Lucretilis, <hi rend="ital">where Atticus had a villa</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 11, 1</bibl></cit> Klotz (dub.; v. lucrativus, I.).</sense></entryFree>
lucretius: <entryFree id="n27088" type="main" key="Lu_^cre_ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lū^crētĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n27088.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens. </sense><sense id="n27088.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Masc.</hi> </sense><sense id="n27088.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The poet</hi> T. Lucretius Carus, <hi rend="ital">an Epicurean in philosophy, author of the poem</hi> De rerum natura, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 11, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:87" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:27" default="NO">12, 11, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:15:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 15, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:7:76" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 7, 76</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27088.3" n="2" level="3"> Sp. Lucretius Tricipitinus, <hi rend="ital">father of Lucretia, consul</hi> A. U. C. 245, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:4:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:31:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 31, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:59:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 59, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27088.4" n="3" level="3"> Q. Lucretius Vespillo, <hi rend="ital">an orator</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:48:178" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 48, 178</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27088.5" n="4" level="3"> Another Lucretius Vespillo, <hi rend="ital">an adherent of Pompey</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27088.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi> </sense><sense id="n27088.7" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lū^crētĭa</orth>, <hi rend="ital">daughter of Sp. Lucretius Tricipitinus, and wife of Collatinus, who, when dishonored by Sex. Tarquinius, put herself to death, and thus became the immediate cause of the expulsion of the Tarquins from Rome</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:25:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 25, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:20:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 20, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:685" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 685</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:293" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 293</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27088.8" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, for <hi rend="ital">a chaste woman</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lucretia toto Sis licet usque die, Laida nocte volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:104:21" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 104, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 9, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lucricupido: <entryFree id="n27089" type="main" key="lu_^cri_cu^pi_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lū^crīcŭpīdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>lucrum-cupido</etym>, <sense id="n27089.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the passion for gain</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Doctr. Plat. 2, p. 20, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lucrifacio: <entryFree id="n27090" type="main" key="lu_^cri^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lū^crĭfăcĭo</orth>, <itype>fēci, factum</itype>, and in <sense id="n27090.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">lū^crĭfīo</orth>, <itype>factus, fieri</itype> (also separately: <cit><quote lang="la">licet lucri dotem faciat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:7:29" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 11, 7, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me esse hos trecentos Philippos facturum lucri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 5, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 2, 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 117</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:3:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 3, 2, 22</bibl>; usu. written as two words in recent edd. of Cic., etc.), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>lucrum facio</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to gain, win, acquire, get</hi> (as profit). </sense><sense id="n27090.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pallium lucrifacere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid si ostendo in hac una optione lucri fieri tritici modios centum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:46:section=111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 46, § 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam lucri factum videtis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 75</bibl></cit>, § 174.—</sense><sense id="n27090.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod lucrifecerunt hoc nomen turdi,</quote> <trans><tr>have appropriated, acquired</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 4</bibl></cit>: suum maleficium existimabant se lucrifacere, <hi rend="ital">that they would escape the punishment of their fault, would get off with impunity</hi>, Auct. B. Hisp. 36: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriam,</quote> <trans><tr>to commit with impunity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 39, 40, § 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">traduc equum ac lucrifac censoriam notam,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>think yourself lucky that you have escaped it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:1:10" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 1, 10</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucrifecit,</quote> <trans><tr>made a profit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lucrifactus: <entryFree id="n27091" type="main" key="lu_^cri^factus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lū^crĭfactus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of lucrifacio.</entryFree>
lucrificabilis: <entryFree id="n27092" type="hapax" key="lu_^cri^fi^ca_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lū^crĭfĭcābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lucrifico</etym>, <sense id="n27092.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gainful, profitable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 7, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lucrifico: <entryFree id="n27093" type="main" key="lu_^cri^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lū^crĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>lucrum-facio</etym>, <sense id="n27093.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to gain, win</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Paulum factum omnibus esse omnia, ut omnes lucrificaret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Praescr. 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lucrificus: <entryFree id="n27094" type="main" key="lu_^cri^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lū^crĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27094.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gainful, profitable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fortuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 46</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lucrifio: <entryFree id="n27095" type="main" key="lu_^cri^fi_o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lū^crĭfīo</orth>, v. lucrifacio <sense id="n27095.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
lucrifuga: <entryFree id="n27096" type="hapax" key="lu_^cri^fu^ga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lū^crĭfŭga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>lucrum-fugio</etym>, <sense id="n27096.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gain-fleeing, gain-shunning</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quom ea (Venus) homines huc ad me adigit lucrifugas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lucrinus: <entryFree id="n27097" type="main" key="Lu_^cri_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lū^crīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, with or without lacus, <sense id="n27097.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Lucrine Lake, on the coast of Campania, in the neighborhood of Baiæ</hi> (now <hi rend="ital">Lago Lucrino</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 16, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 15, 3</bibl>. Cæsar, or, acc. to Suetonius, Augustus, connected it with Lake Avernus, and threw up dikes to ward off the waves of the sea: <cit><quote lang="la">Lucrinoque addita claustra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 161</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 5</bibl>. The surrounding scenery was celebrated for its beauty: dum nos <pb n="1081" /> <cb n="LUCR" /> blanda tenent lascivi stagna Lucrini, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:57:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 57, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic mihi Baiani colles mollisque Lucrinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:43:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 43, 5</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n27097.1" n="II" level="1"> </sense><sense id="n27097.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lū^-crīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Lake Lucrinus, Lucrine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <trans><tr>the Lucrine Lake</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:11:10" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 11, 10</bibl></cit>: ostrea Lucrina, <hi rend="ital">the Lucrine oysters</hi>, celebrated for their delicious flavor, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 54, 79, § 168</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Lucrinum ad saxum ... ostrea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:141" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 141</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also Lucrina conchylia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:49" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 49</bibl></cit>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lū^crīna</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:11:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 11, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:48:4" default="NO">12, 48, 4</bibl>.—Near the lake was a temple of Venus; <cit><quote lang="la">hence: Lucrina Venus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:1:150" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 1, 150</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27097.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lū^crīnensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Lucrine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res Puteolanae et Lucrinenses,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>oysters</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 10, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lucrio: <entryFree id="n27098" type="gloss" key="lu_^cri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lū^crĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>lucrum</etym>, <sense id="n27098.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one fond of gain</hi>: <foreign lang="greek">ke/rdwna</foreign>, quem nos quoque lucrionem vocamus, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=56" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 56</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
lucripeta: <entryFree id="n27099" type="main" key="lu_^cri^pe^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lū^crĭpĕta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>lucrum-peto</etym>, <sense id="n27099.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gainseeker, one fond of lucre</hi>: lucripeta fenerator, Argum. Most. <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> 6</bibl>.—Collat. form in <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lū^crĭpĕtes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 12, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lucrius: <entryFree id="n27100" type="main" key="lu_^cri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lū^crĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lucrum</etym>, <sense id="n27100.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to gain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">di Lucrii,</quote> <trans><tr>gods of gain</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 132</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lucror: <entryFree id="n27101" type="main" key="lu_^cror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lū^cror</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n27101.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to gain, win, acquire, get, make</hi> (as profit). </sense><sense id="n27101.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum lucrari impune posset auri pondo decem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:3:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut locupletes suum perdant, debitores lucrentur alienum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:24:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 24, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipendium,</quote> <trans><tr>to keep for one's self, put into one's own pocket</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:24:section=61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 24, § 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pythias emuncto lucrata Simone talentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:238" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 238</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucrandi perdendive temeritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui duo acceperat lucratus est alia duo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:25:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 25, 17</bibl></cit>: majorem partem lucrari, <hi rend="ital">to receive the larger share of profit</hi> in a partnership, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:149" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 149</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27101.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to gain by economy, to save</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">occasione lucrandi salis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 12, § 68</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27101.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to acquire, gain, win</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui domitā nomen ab Africā Lucratus rediit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucretur indicia veteris infamiae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>I will make him a present of them, I will not mention them</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:12:section=33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 12, § 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:779" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 779</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27101.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To win, persuade, convert</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">factus sum Judaeis tamquam Judaeus, ut Judaeos lucrarer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Cor. 9, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lucrose: <entryFree id="n27102" type="main" key="lu_^crose_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lū^crosē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. lucrosus <sense id="n27102.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
lucrosus: <entryFree id="n27103" type="main" key="lu_^cro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lū^crōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lucrum</etym>, <sense id="n27103.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gainful, profitable, lucrative</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:10:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 10, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraus lucrosior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 12, 75, § 197</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id peraeque etiam lucrosissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:320" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 31, 74, § 320</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭcrōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">profitably, advantageously</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 12, 20</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucrosius perire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 22</bibl></cit>, n. 13 al.</sense></entryFree>
lucrum: <entryFree id="n27104" type="main" key="lu_^crum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lū^crum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>root laf-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">la/w, a)polau/w</foreign>; Goth. Laun; Germ. Lohn; cf. Laverna</etym>, <sense id="n27104.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gain, profit, advantage</hi> (syn.: quaestus, compendium; cf.: commodum, fructus). </sense><sense id="n27104.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem gero et facio lucrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoi di sunt homini propitii lucrum ei obiciunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ego omnino lucrum omne esse utile homini existumo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucrum facere (opp. damnum facere),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vendendi quaestu et lucro ducerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:3:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid ad praedam lucrumque revocare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 12, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ex publicis vectigalibus tanta lucra fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:38:section=86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 38, § 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentaria lucra exigere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 37</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">85: dat de lucro, nihil detrahit de vivo: minus igitur lucri facit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 37, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucri bonus est odor ex re qualibet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:208" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 208</bibl></cit>: lucro est, <hi rend="ital">it is profitable, advantageous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobis lucro fuisti potius quam decori tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amanti amoenitas malo est, nobis lucro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod in divinis rebus sumptumst sapienti lucrost,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 52</bibl>: ponere or deputare in lucro, <hi rend="ital">to count as gain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne id deputare esse in lucro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">id ego in lucris pono,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 24, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quem sors dierum cunque dabit lucro Appone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:9:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 9, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in lucro, quae datur hora, mihi est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:3:67" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 3, 67</bibl></cit>: lucri facere, <hi rend="ital">to gain, get the credit of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae ille universa naturali quodam bono fecit lucri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Thras. 1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Thras. 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. lucrifacio: lucrum et damnum,</quote> <trans><tr>profit and loss</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:150" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 150</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Fragm. 25, 15</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui mensis damnis, quae dentur tempora lucro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:571" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 571</bibl></cit>: <cb n="LUCT" /> quom scis jam senex, tum in otium Te conloces, dum potis ames; <cit><quote lang="la">id jam lucrist, Quor vivas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de lucro prope jam quadriennium vivimus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>as by a miracle, in constant, imminent danger of death</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de lucro tibi vivere me scito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (Mercurius) me in mercimoniis Juvit lucrisque quadruplicavit rem meam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 3, 1, 4</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n27104.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27104.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Love of gain, avarice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucri pallida tabes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impius lucri furor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 4:540" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 4, 540</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27104.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Wealth, riches</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne lucrum tenebris alta premebat humus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:8:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 8, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculosum semper putavi lucrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non turpe lucrum sectantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Tim. 3, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lucta: <entryFree id="n27105" type="main" key="lucta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lucta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>root lug-; cf. <foreign lang="greek">lugi/zw</foreign>, to writhe, ligare</etym>, <sense id="n27105.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wrestling, wrestling-match</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">exercebat cum militibus ipse luctam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Maxim. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certamen luctae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 93</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27105.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">perseverans quodammodo lucta convincitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 606" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 606</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
luctamen: <entryFree id="n27106" type="main" key="lucta_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">luctāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27106.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wrestling</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27106.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 30</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27106.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27106.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A struggling, struggle</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 30, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27106.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Toil, exertion, contest, fight</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">remo ut luctamen abesset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 89</bibl></cit>: Veneris luctamen anhelum exercere, Auct. Epith. in <bibl default="NO"><author>Anthol. Lat.</author> T. II. p. 636</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lento luctamine Poenum compressit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. G. 138</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27106.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A mixing together, mixture</hi> of materials of different kinds: <cit><quote lang="la">sine luctamine alterius generis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 3, 9, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27106.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed emendatio morum difficile luctamen fuit,</quote> <trans><tr>labor, task</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mamert.</author> Grat. Act. ad Jul. 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
luctans: <entryFree id="n27107" type="main" key="luctans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">luctans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. luctor <sense id="n27107.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
luctatianus: <entryFree id="n27108" type="main" key="Lucta_ti^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Luctātĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. Lutatius, II.</entryFree>
luctatio: <entryFree id="n27109" type="main" key="lucta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">luctātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>luctor</etym>, <sense id="n27109.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wrestling</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27109.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine adversario nulla luctatio est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:13:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 13, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid prodest multos vincere luctatione vel caestu, ab iracundia vinci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 88:19" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 88, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 273" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 273</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:101" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> 101</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27109.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a struggle, contest, fight</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tetra ibi luctatio erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:36:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 36, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:13:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 13, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plurium ventorum inter ipsos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 7:9:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 9, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:15:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 15, 38</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27109.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of mental or moral wrestling, <hi rend="ital">a struggle, contest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam cum Academicis incerta luctatio est, qui nihil affirmant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:14:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 14, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:6:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 6, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 19, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">una tamen veluti luctatio civitatis fuit, pugnantis cum Caesare senatus populique Romani, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:124:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 124, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">una nobis et magna et praecipua cum carne est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 25, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
luctatius: <entryFree id="n27110" type="main" key="Lucta_tius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Luctātius</orth>, v. Lutatius.</entryFree>
luctator: <entryFree id="n27111" type="main" key="lucta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">luctātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>luctor</etym>, <sense id="n27111.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wrestler</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27111.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortior in fulva novus est luctator arena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:6:31" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 6, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luctator ter abjectus perdidit palmam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:3:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 5, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 88:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 88, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:8:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 8, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:12" default="NO">12, 2, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27111.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp. <hi rend="ital">a wrestler</hi> represented in art: <cit><quote lang="la">Naucerus luctatorem anhelantem fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 80</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:130" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 11, 40, § 130</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27111.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: (vinum) pedes captat primum, luctator dolosus est, <hi rend="ital">a treacherous foe</hi>, in allusion to the wrestler, who strove to grasp his opponent's feet, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 1, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
luctatus: <entryFree id="n27112" type="main" key="lucta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">luctātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27112.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wrestling</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 8, § 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 12, 12, § 33</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
luctifer: <entryFree id="n27113" type="main" key="lucti^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">luctĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>luctus-fero</etym>, <sense id="n27113.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">grief - bringing, mournful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illic luctifer bubo gemit,</quote> <trans><tr>ill-boding</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 687" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 687</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:454" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 454</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
luctificabilis: <entryFree id="n27114" type="main" key="lucti^fi^ca_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">luctĭfĭcābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>luctus - facio</etym>, <sense id="n27114.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sorrowful, afflicted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:78" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 78</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
luctificus: <entryFree id="n27115" type="main" key="lucti^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">luctĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27115.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">causing sorrow</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lamentation, doleful, woful, baleful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clades, Cic. poët. Tusc. 2, 10, 25: Alecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:324" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 324</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:557" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 557</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jubar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:292" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 292</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> as <pos>adv.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">luctificum clangente tuba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:348" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 348</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
luctisonus: <entryFree id="n27116" type="hapax" key="lucti^so^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">luctĭsŏnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>luctus-sonus</etym>, <sense id="n27116.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sad-sounding, mournful, doleful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mugitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:732" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 732</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
luctito: <entryFree id="n27117" type="gloss" key="lucti^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">luctĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n27117.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> [lucto], <hi rend="ital">to wrestle violently</hi>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 797</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
lucto: <entryFree id="n27118" type="main" key="lucto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lucto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n27118.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr> <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
luctor: <entryFree id="n27119" type="main" key="luctor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">luctor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype> (<sense id="n27119.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">part. gen. plur.</hi> luctantūm, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 22, 9; <hi rend="ital">act.</hi> collat. form: viri validis viribus luctant, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 472, 8</bibl>: plurimum luctavimus, Plaut. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 468, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:10:section=61" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 10, § 61</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">dum luctat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 3, 31</bibl></cit>), <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>lucta, q. v.</etym>, <cb n="LUCT" /> <hi rend="ital">to wrestle.</hi> </sense><sense id="n27119.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi cursu luctando disco hasta ... sese exercebant (juventus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luctabitur Olympiis Milo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:chapter=13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulvā luctantur harenā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:643" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 643</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luctabatur adsidue,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:53" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paucae (feminae) luctantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:53" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umeris, ut luctaturi solent, ad occipitium ductis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:160" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 160</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27119.2" n="B" level="2"> Transf, <hi rend="ital">to wrestle, struggle, strive, contend.</hi> </sense><sense id="n27119.3" n="a" level="4"> Of living creatures: <cit><quote lang="la">in pestilenti atque arido solo luctari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:38:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 38, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">boves luctari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 19, 49, § 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luctandum in turbā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter se adversis luctantur cornibus haedi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:526" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 526</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non luctor de nomine hujus temporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:69" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 69</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n27119.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">et infracta luctatur harundine telum Eripere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:387" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 387</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deducere versum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:5:13" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">compescere risum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 17, 161</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:300" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 15, 300</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n27119.5" n="b" level="4"> Of inanimate things: <cit><quote lang="la">et in lento luctantur marmore tonsae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> A, 7, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tristia robustis luctantur funera plaustris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 74</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 1, 147: <cit><quote lang="la">luctantem Icariis fluctibus Africum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">luctantes venti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27119.6" n="2" level="3"> In partic., in mal. part.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:13" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 1, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27119.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of mental or moral strife, <hi rend="ital">to struggle, strive, contend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non luctabor tecum amplius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:17:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 17, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliquo luctari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:16:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 16, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Plancus diu, quarum esset partium secum luctatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:63:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 63, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 5, 6, § 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum latentibus nodis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:1:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ardore et siccitate regionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:7:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 7, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27119.8" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>dat.</case> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">luctataeque diu tenebris hiemique sibique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:522" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 522</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crudo pelago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:453" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 453</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:296" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 296</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27119.9" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis viridi luctetur robore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:503" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 503</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:86:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 86, 2</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">luctans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., struggling, reluctant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">luctantia oscula carpere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:358" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 358</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">composuit luctantia lumina somnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:204" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 204</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27119.10" n="B" level="2"> In partic., as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, of cross-beams, rafters, because they oppose and uphold each other like wrestlers, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
luctuose: <entryFree id="n27120" type="main" key="luctu^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">luctŭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. luctuosus <sense id="n27120.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
luctuosus: <entryFree id="n27121" type="main" key="luctu^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">luctŭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>luctus</etym>, <sense id="n27121.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of sorrow</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27121.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Causing sorrow, sorrowful, lamentable, doleful, mournful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">o diem illum rei publicae luctuosum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 12, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuit hoc luctuosum suis, acerbum patriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">misera tempora et luctuosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luctuosum est tradi alteri luctuosius inimico,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 31, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luctuosissimum exitium patriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:33:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 33, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luctuosae preces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 19, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud luctuosum, quod Julius Avitus decessit, dum ex praetura redit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 21, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27121.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Feeling sorrow, sorrowful, sad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dii multa dederunt Hesperiae luctuosae mala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 6, 7</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">luctŭōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">dolefully, mournfully</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">luctuose canere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=76" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 76</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">illud autem quam luctuose ridiculum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:de Op. Monach. 32:section=42" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> de Op. Monach. 32, § 42</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperatores vestri luctuosius nobis prope, quam vobis perierunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:39:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 39, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
luctus: <entryFree id="n27122" type="main" key="luctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">luctus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype> (<sense id="n27122.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> lucti, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 485, 30</bibl> and 32), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>lugeo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">sorrow, mourning, grief, affliction, distress, lamentation</hi>, esp. over the loss of something dear to one. </sense><sense id="n27122.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">filius luctu perditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 8, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orat, ne suum luctum patris lacrimis augeatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 42, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in sordibus, lamentis, luctuque jacuisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:36:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 36, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">afflictus et confectus luctu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">re cognitā tantus luctus excepit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luctu atque caede omnia complentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furere luctu filii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:46:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 46, 193</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in maximos luctus incidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:10:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 10, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luctum alicui importare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:28:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 28, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare animum in luctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:384" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 384</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luctus aliquando ridicula fuerit imitatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis in luctibus, inque perpetuo maerore senescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:244" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 244</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27122.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27122.3" n="A" level="2"> The external signs of sorrow in one's dress and gestures, <hi rend="ital">mourning, mourning apparel, weeds</hi> (usually worn by the bereaved, and also by accused persons): <cit><quote lang="la">erat in luctu senatus, squalebat civitas, publico consilio mutatā veste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:14:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 14, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia discessu meo plena luctūs et maeroris fuerunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 60, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatusconsulto diebus triginta luctus est finitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Plancina luctum amissae sororis tum primum laeto cultu mutavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 75</bibl></cit>: minuitur populo luctus aedis dedicatione ... privatis autem, cum liberi nati sunt, etc., <pb n="1082" /> <cb n="LUCU" /> Fest. s. v. minuitur, p. 154 Müll.—</sense><sense id="n27122.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A source of grief</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu non inventa repertā Luctus eras levior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:655" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 655</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">et luctum et curam effugies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:157" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 157</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27122.5" n="C" level="2"> Personified: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Luctus</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the god of grief</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">primisque in faucibus Orci Luctus et ultrices posuere cubilia Curae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 274</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:581" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 581</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:126" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 126</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lucu: <entryFree id="n27123" type="main" key="lu_cu_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūcū</orth>, <sense id="n27123.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. adv.</hi>, v. lux, I. 2. b.</sense></entryFree>
lucubratio: <entryFree id="n27124" type="main" key="lu_cu_^bra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūcū^brātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>lucubro</etym>, <sense id="n27124.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a working by lamp-light, night-work, nocturnal study, lucubration.</hi> </sense><sense id="n27124.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">per hiemem lucubratione haec facito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucubrationes detraxi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:68:142" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 68, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ista sunt tota commenticia, vix digna lucubratione anicularum,</quote> <trans><tr>hardly worth the evening gossip of old women</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:34:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 34, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cannabis lucubrationibus decorticata purgatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 9, 56, § 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est enim lucubratio, quoties ad eam integri ac refecti venimus, optimum secreti genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et vigilandae noctes, et fuligo lucubrationum bibenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 23</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n27124.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">any thing done</hi> or <hi rend="ital">composed at night, night-work, lucubration</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perire lucubrationem meam nolui, i. e. epistolam noctu scriptam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—As title of a work by Bibaculus, Plin. praef. § 24.</sense></entryFree>
lucubratiuncula: <entryFree id="n27125" type="main" key="lu_cu_^bra_ti^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūcū^brātĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>lucubratio</etym>, <sense id="n27125.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a working by night, sitting up at night</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n27125.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, Marc. Aur. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:ad Ep. M. Caes. 1:3" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> ad Ep. M. Caes. 1, 3</bibl> Mai.—</sense><sense id="n27125.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">night-work, lucubration</hi>, Gell. N. A. praef. § 14.</sense></entryFree>
lucubratorius: <entryFree id="n27126" type="hapax" key="lu_cu_^bra_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūcū^brātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lucubro</etym>, <sense id="n27126.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a night-student</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lecticula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:78" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 78</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lucubro: <entryFree id="n27127" type="main" key="lu_cu_^bro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūcū^bro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n27127.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [lux], <hi rend="ital">to work by lamp-light, work at night.</hi> </sense><sense id="n27127.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Lucretiam) deditam lanae inter lucubrantes ancillas inveniunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:57:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 57, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sin lucubrandum est, non post cibum id facere, sed post concoctionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 5, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27127.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to make by lamp-light, to compose at night</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvum opusculum lucubratum his jam contractioribus noctibus, Cic. Par. prooem. § 5: nox lucubrata,</quote> <trans><tr>spent in work</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:90:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 90, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viam,</quote> <trans><tr>to travel by night</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 186</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lucubrum: <entryFree id="n27128" type="gloss" key="lu_cu^brum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūcŭbrum</orth> <itype>vocatum</itype>, quod luceat in umbra. Est enim modicus ignis, qui solet ex tenui stuppa ceraque formari, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 20, 10, 8</bibl>.</entryFree>
luculentas: <entryFree id="n27129" type="main" key="lu_cu^lentas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūcŭlentas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>luculentus</etym>, <sense id="n27129.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">splendor</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
luculente: <entryFree id="n27130" type="main" key="lu_cu^lente_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūcŭlentē</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">lūcŭlenter</orth>, <sense id="n27130.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">advv.</hi>, v. luculentus <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
luculentia: <entryFree id="n27131" type="main" key="lu_cu^lenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūcŭlentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>luculentus</etym>, <sense id="n27131.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">brilliancy, beauty</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">verborum luculentiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 103</bibl></cit> (p. 111 Orell.).—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scriptorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Oros.</author> 5, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
luculentitas: <entryFree id="n27132" type="main" key="lu_cu^lenti^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūcŭlentĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27132.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">excellence, splendor, magnificence</hi>: luculentitate captus, Lab. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 135, 2</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 71 Rib.): alicujus, Caecil. ib. (Com. Rel. v. 90 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
luculentus: <entryFree id="n27133" type="main" key="lu_cu^lentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūcŭlentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lux</etym>, <sense id="n27133.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of light, bright, splendid.</hi> </sense><sense id="n27133.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestibulum et ambulacrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">camino luculento uti,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>brightly burning, having a good fire in it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 10, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n27133.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27133.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Distinguished, excellent of its kind</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">luculenta et festiva femina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 1, 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: legio luculentissima, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 24, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba luculentiora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scriptor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <trans><tr>perspicuous, fine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plaga,</quote> <trans><tr>great, serious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 7, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navigia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 4, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27133.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Respectable, considerable, rich</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">divitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">familia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 2, 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna et luculenta hereditas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">condicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucrum homines luculentos reddidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:7:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 7, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrimonium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 8, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27133.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Clear, satisfactorily proved</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">est luculenta res Aureliani indiciis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 16, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27133.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Lucky, fortunate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27133.7" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Trustworthy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scriptor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:26:102" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 26, 102</bibl></cit>: constantia, Just. Inst. prooem. 2.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>, in two forms: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lūcŭlentē</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">lūcŭlenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">splendidly, excellently, well</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27133.8" n="1" level="3"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">lūcŭlentē</orth>: <cit><quote lang="la">eamus intro huc ad te, et hunc hodie diem luculente habeamus,</quote> <trans><tr>in jollity, merrily</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 55</bibl></cit>: vendere, <cb n="LUCU" /> <hi rend="ital">to advantage</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 88</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">luculente scripserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:19:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 19, 76</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:28:102" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 28, 102</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 21, 1</bibl>: calefacere aliquem, <hi rend="ital">to give one a thorough warming</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">beating</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 2, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27133.9" n="2" level="3"> Form <orth extent="full" lang="la">lūcŭ-lenter</orth>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc quidem sane luculenter,</quote> <trans><tr>very well said</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:14:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 14, 60</bibl></cit> (al. luculente): <cit><quote lang="la">Graece luculenter scire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:5:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus texere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lucullus: <entryFree id="n27134" type="main" key="Lu_cullus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lūcullus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n27134.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a family name in the</hi> gens Licinia. The most celebrated is L. Licinius Lucullus, <hi rend="ital">the conqueror of Mithridates, famous for his great wealth and luxury</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:8:20 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 8, 20 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 1 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 26</bibl> saep.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n27134.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lūcullānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Lucullan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 5" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carinae,</quote> <trans><tr>the fleet of Mithridates, defeated by Lucullus</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 2, 54</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27134.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lūcullēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Lucullan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">marmor,</quote> <trans><tr>a sort of marble found on an island in the Nile, and of which Lucullus was particularly fond</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 2, 2, § 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:49" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 6, 8, § 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lancea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 10</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n27134.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lūculliānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Lucullan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">horti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">villa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:73" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 73</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2</bibl> and 13.</sense></entryFree>
luculus: <entryFree id="n27135" type="main" key="lu_cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>lucus</etym>, <sense id="n27135.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small grove</hi>, Suet. Vit. Hor. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
lucumo: <entryFree id="n27136" type="main" key="lu^cu^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭcŭmo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭcŏmo</orth>, and sync. <orth extent="full" lang="la">luc-mo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">lucmon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Etrusc. Lauchme</etym>, orig., <sense id="n27136.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one possessed, an inspired person</hi>: lucumones quidam homines ob insaniam dicti, quod loca ad quae venissent, infesta facerent, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=120" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 120</bibl> Müll. —</sense><sense id="n27136.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27136.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An appellation of the Etruscan princes and priests</hi>, like the Roman patricius: <cit><quote lang="la">Tuscia duodecim Lucumones habuit, i. e. reges, quibus unus praeerat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 8, 475</bibl></cit>, and 2, 278: Lucomedi a duce suo Lucomo dicti qui postea Lucereses appellati sunt, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=120" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 120</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 9</bibl> Creuz.; Müll. ad loc.—</sense><sense id="n27136.3" n="B" level="2"> Mistaken by the Romans for a proper name, it is given to <hi rend="ital">the son of Demaratus of Corinth, afterwards Tarquinius Priscus, king of Rome</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Anco regnante, Lucumo, vir impiger ac divitiis potens, Romam commigravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:34:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 34, 1</bibl></cit> sqq.: <cit><quote lang="la">invexisse in Galliam vinum Arruntem Clusinum irā corruptae uxoris ab Lucumone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:33:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 33, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 2, 51 (Müll. Lycomedius).—</sense><sense id="n27136.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An Etrurian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prima galeritus posuit praetoria Lucmo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 1, 29 (Lygmon, Müll.).—</sense><sense id="n27136.5" n="D" level="2"> Lucumo Samius, for <hi rend="ital">Pythagoras</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 4, 68</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lŭcŭmōnĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an Etruscan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:2:51" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 2, 51</bibl> dub. (5, 2, 51 Müll. Lycomedius).</sense></entryFree>
lucuna: <entryFree id="n27137" type="main" key="lu^cuna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭcuna</orth>, v. lacuna <sense id="n27137.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
lucunculus: <entryFree id="n27138" type="main" key="lu^cuncu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭcuncŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>lucuns</etym>, <sense id="n27138.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of pastry</hi>, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 131, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">molles caseoli lucunculique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:6:17" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 6, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 245, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 66</bibl>: lucunculus, <foreign lang="greek">thgani/ths</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
lucuns: <entryFree id="n27139" type="main" key="lu^cuns"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭcuns</orth>, <itype>untis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>root lic or luc, crooked, as in obliquus, luxus; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">loco/s</foreign>; cf.: licinus, limus</etym>, <sense id="n27139.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of pastry</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 131, 24</bibl>; cf.: lucuntem genus operis pistorii, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=119" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 119</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
lucus: <entryFree id="n27140" type="main" key="lu_cus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>luceo, the shining, i. e. open place in the wood</etym>, <sense id="n27140.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wood, grove</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">thicket of trees sacred to a deity.</hi> </sense><sense id="n27140.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Silani lucus extra murumst est avius crebro salicto oppletus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucus est arborum multitudo cum religione, nemus vero composita multitudo arborum, silva diffusa et inculta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 310</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 441</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">11, 316: vos jam, Albani tumuli atque luci, imploro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:31:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 31, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucus frequenti silvā septus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemora in domibus sacros imitantia lucos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:3:15" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutem verba putas et Lucum ligna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ennium sicut sacros vetustate lucos adoremus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:88" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemoris sacri lucos tenere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 956" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 956</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27140.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27140.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a wood</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">aut quos Oceano propior gerit India lucos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alto in luco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:456" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 11, 456</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27140.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Wood</hi>: nec quicquam positum sine luco, auro, ebore, argento, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 179</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n27141" type="main" key="Lu_cus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lūcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. lucus</etym>, the name of several cities in Gaul and Spain, of which the most important was <sense id="n27141.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Lucus, a city of the Vocontii</hi>, also called Lucus Augusti, now <hi rend="ital">Lucim</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 4, 5, § 37</bibl>. <cb n="LUDI" /></sense></entryFree>
