<entryFree id="n27142" type="main" key="lu_cus3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūcus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, i. q. lux, <sense id="n27142.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">light</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum primo lucu,</quote> <trans><tr>at daybreak</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 56</bibl></cit> (dub.; <cit><quote lang="la">Fleck. and Ussing, luci): noctu lucuque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:19:section=99" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 19, § 99</bibl></cit> Müll. (ex conj.; al. noctulucus).</sense></entryFree>
lucusta: <entryFree id="n27143" type="main" key="Lu_custa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lūcusta</orth>, v. 2. Locusta.</entryFree>
ludia: <entryFree id="n27144" type="main" key="lu_di^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūdĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. ludius</etym>. <sense id="n27144.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An actress, a female stage-dancer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:25:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 25, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27144.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A female gladiator, a gladiator's wife</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mistress</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid vidit, propter quod ludia dici Sustinuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:103" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae ludia sumpserit umquam hos habitus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:266" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 266</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ludiarius: <entryFree id="n27145" type="gloss" key="lu_di^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūdĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. ludius, ludus</etym>, <sense id="n27145.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to players</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunia,</quote> <trans><tr>the money appropriated by the state for the getting up of plays</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2601</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ludibriose: <entryFree id="n27146" type="main" key="lu_di_^bri^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūdī^brĭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. ludibriosus <sense id="n27146.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
ludibriosus: <entryFree id="n27147" type="main" key="lu_di_^bri^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūdī^brĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ludibrium</etym>, <sense id="n27147.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of mockery</hi> or <hi rend="ital">scorn, mocking, scornful</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">probra ludibriosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auspicia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 5, 25</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lūdī^brĭosē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">scornfully</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 26, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 61</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ludibrium: <entryFree id="n27148" type="main" key="lu_di_^bri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūdī^brĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>ludus and, perh., fero</etym>, <sense id="n27148.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mockery, derision, wantonness.</hi> </sense><sense id="n27148.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quodsi ridicula haec ludibriaque esse videmus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne per ludibrium interiret regnum,</quote> <trans><tr>by wantonness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 4, 2</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n27148.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen. subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille (Bias) haec ludibria fortunae ne sua quidem putavit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>worldly goods</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:1:1:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 1, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc quoque ludibrium casus ediderit fortuna, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter magna rerum verborumque ludibria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludibria naturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 83</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27148.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen. obj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludibrium oculorum specie terribile ad frustrandum hostem commentus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 16</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive ludibrium oculorum sive vera species,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:15:26" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 15, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27148.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27148.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A laughing-stock, butt, jest, sport</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">is (Brutus) ab Tarquiniis ductus Delphos, ludibrium verius, quam comes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:56:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 56, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus mihi ludibrio fuisse videntur divitiae,</quote> <trans><tr>the sport of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ora hominum pro ludibrio abire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludibrium soceri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:379" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 379</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pelagi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:710" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 710</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventis Debes ludibrium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:14:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 14, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludibrium omnium reddere aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:6:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 9, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et vultus et vox ludibrio sunt hominibus, quos non permoverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:45" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27148.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A scoff, jest, sport</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui lubet ludibrio habere me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 3, 45</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ludibrio aliquem habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 5, 19</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludibrio haberi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 74</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 1, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hosti ludibrio esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,059:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> ad Brut. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legati per ludibrium auditi dimissique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per ludibrium exprobrare,</quote> <trans><tr>to reproach jestingly, scoff</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec dubie ludibrio esse miserias suas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:2:23:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 23, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in ludibrium reservare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adusque ludibria ebriosus,</quote> <trans><tr>such a drunkard as to be a standing jest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:2:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27148.7" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen. subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Varro ad ludibrium moriturus Antonii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:71:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 71, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27148.8" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen. obj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad ludibrium stolidae superbiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:41" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludibrio fratris Remum novos transiluisse muros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 36, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27148.9" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Abuse, violence</hi> done to a woman: <cit><quote lang="la">in corporum ludibria deflere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:1:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:10:27" default="NO">4, 10, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ludibrosus: <entryFree id="n27149" type="main" key="lu_di_^bro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūdī^brōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ludibrium</etym>, <sense id="n27149.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ridiculous</hi>: habitus, Hilar. in Psa. 41, 1.</sense></entryFree>
ludibundus: <entryFree id="n27150" type="main" key="lu_di^bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūdĭbundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ludo</etym>, <sense id="n27150.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">playful, sportive, frolicsome, wanton</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27150.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sic palliolatim amictus hac incessi ludibundus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites ita ludibundi Beneventum rediere, ut ab epulis reverti viderentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circum vicos vagabatur ludibundus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi ludibundi atque illecebrae voluptatisque plenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:5:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 5, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27150.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">playing, easily, without danger</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelo sereno in Italiam ludibundi pervenimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si Vulteium habebis, omnia ludibundus conficies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:67:section=156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 67, § 156</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ludicer: <entryFree id="n27151" type="main" key="lu_di^cer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūdĭcer</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">lūdī^crus</orth> (<sense id="n27151.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nom. sing. m.</hi> is not used), <itype>cra, crum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ludus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">that serves for sport, done in sport, sportive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:37:102" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 37, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludicrae artes sunt, quae ad voluptatem oculorum atque aurium tendunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 88:22" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 88, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludicras partes sustinere,</quote> <trans><tr>to appear on the stage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:8:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibiae,</quote> <trans><tr>which were played in the theatre</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 36, 66, § 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in modum ludicrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14</bibl></cit>. 14: versus et cetera ludicra pono, <pb n="1083" /> <cb n="LUDI" /> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus (juvenibus) id ludicrum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solemnibus epulis ludicra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac lege excipiuntur qui artem ludicram faciunt,</quote> <trans><tr>actors</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 26, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">quae artem ludicram fecerit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Fragm. 13, 1 sq.</bibl></cit>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">lūdī^-crum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n27151.1" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A show, public games; a scenic show, stage-play</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Olympiorum solemne ludicrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Isthmiorum statum ludicrum aderat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:32:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 32, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:41:1" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 41, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">iisdem fere diebus sollemne erat ludicrum Isthmiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:5:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indulserat ei ludicro Augustus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coronae ludicro quaesitae,</quote> <trans><tr>won in the public games</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 3, 5, § 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid maris extremos Arabas ditantis et Indos, Ludicra quid, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 7</bibl></cit> Orell. ad loc.—</sense><sense id="n27151.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A sport, toy, means of sport</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos (ramulos) Hamadryades deae ludicrum sibi rosido nutriunt umore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 24</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">urbes duae, quae in proverbii ludicrum vertere, Apina et Trica,</quote> <trans><tr>sport</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 16, § 104</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et versus et cetera ludicra pono,</quote> <trans><tr>trifles</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. K. and H. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 7</bibl>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lūdī^crē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in sport, playfully</hi> (ante- and post-class.): pars ludicre saxa jactant, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 134, 14</bibl> (Ann. v. 76 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">tractare aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">220, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ludicror: <entryFree id="n27152" type="main" key="lu_di_^cror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūdī^cror</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>ludicrum</etym>, <sense id="n27152.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to joke, jest</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:ad Amic. 1:15" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> ad Amic. 1, 15</bibl> Mai.</sense></entryFree>
ludicrus: <entryFree id="n27153" type="main" key="lu_di_^crus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūdī^crus</orth>, v. ludicer.</entryFree>
ludifacio: <entryFree id="n27154" type="hapax" key="lu_di^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūdĭfăcĭo</orth>, <itype>fēci, factum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>collat. form of ludifico</etym>, <sense id="n27154.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make game of, make sport of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem de aliqua re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 2, 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ludificabilis: <entryFree id="n27155" type="hapax" key="lu_di^fi^ca_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūdĭfĭcābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ludifico</etym>, <sense id="n27155.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with which one makes game of</hi> a person: <cit><quote lang="la">ludi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ludificatio: <entryFree id="n27156" type="main" key="lu_di^fi^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūdĭfĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27156.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a making game, a rallying, jeering, derision, mocking</hi>: cum omni morā, ludificatione, calumniā senatūs auctoritas impediretur, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:35:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 35, 75</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exactā prope aestate per ludificationem hostis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludificatio veri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ludificator: <entryFree id="n27157" type="hapax" key="lu_di^fi^ca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūdĭfĭcātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27157.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who makes game of</hi> another, <hi rend="ital">a mocker</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludificator meus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 1, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ludificatorius: <entryFree id="n27158" type="main" key="lu_di^fi^ca_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūdĭfĭcātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ludificator</etym>, <sense id="n27158.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that makes game of</hi> one, <hi rend="ital">mocking, deceptive, false</hi>: phantasmatum imaginatio ludificatoria, Aug. Civ. Dei, 11, 26: ubi fuit procuratoris ludificatoria, inanis et nulla persona, Vet. Jureconsult. 3, 2 Huschke.</sense></entryFree>
ludificatus: <entryFree id="n27159" type="hapax" key="lu_di^fi^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūdĭfĭcātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>ludifico</etym>, <sense id="n27159.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mocking, mockery, derision</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">habere aliquem ludificatui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 5, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ludifico: <entryFree id="n27160" type="main" key="lu_di^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūdĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum</itype> (<sense id="n27160.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. pass.</hi> ludificarier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 1, 27</bibl>), <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>ludus-facio</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to make sport of, make game of, make a fool of; to delude, chouse, cozen, deceive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">erum meum ut ego hodie lusi lepide! ut ludificatus est!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erum qui ludificas dictis delirantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 1, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hospitam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam video me sic ludificarier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 1, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 8, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:939" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 939</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: si latitare ac diutius ludificare videatur, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 17, 54</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ludificor: <entryFree id="n27161" type="main" key="lu_di^fi^cor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūdĭfĭcor</orth>, <itype>ātus sum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n27161.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [id.] (<hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> ludificarier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 4, 25</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">to make game, to mock; to make game of, make sport of, turn into ridicule; to delude, deceive.</hi> </sense><sense id="n27161.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27161.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aperte ludificari et calumniari,</quote> <trans><tr>to mock, ridicule</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:20:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 20, 55</bibl></cit>.—With <case>acc.</case> of kindred signif.: <cit><quote lang="la">nugas ludificabitur,</quote> <trans><tr>will make game of you in trifles</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 80</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27161.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Potin' ut hominem mihi des? ... ni ludificata ero lepide, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tun me, verbero, audes erum ludificari?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me ludificatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 5, 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virginem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">siquidem tu me hic etiam, nebulo, ludificabere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 4, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patres et plebem cunctatione fictā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliena mala,</quote> <trans><tr>to make sport of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27161.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to thwart, frustrate</hi>, by tricks or contrivances: <cit><quote lang="la">locationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39</bibl></cit>. 44: <cit><quote lang="la">ea, quae hostes agerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rostra fuga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:2:8" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostis impune Romanum ludificabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 21</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. part.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludificato incerto proelio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 50:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 50, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27161.5" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quojus ego hodie ludificabor corium, si vivo, probe,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>cut up, lash</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 1, 19</bibl></cit> Lorenz. <cb n="LUDO" /></sense></entryFree>
ludimagister: <entryFree id="n27162" type="main" key="lu_di_ma^gister"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūdīmăgister</orth> (better separately, <orth extent="full" lang="la">lūdī măgister</orth>), <itype>tri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>ludus-magister</etym>, <sense id="n27162.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a school-master, school-teacher</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum agellus eum non satis aleret, ut opinor, ludi magister fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:26:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 26, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dionysius ludimagistrum professus pueros in trivio docebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:5:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 21, 5, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:62:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 62, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ludimentum: <entryFree id="n27163" type="gloss" key="lu_di^mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūdĭmentum</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">pai/gnion</foreign> (<sense id="n27163.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plaything</hi>), Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
ludio: <entryFree id="n27164" type="main" key="lu_di^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūdĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>ludus</etym>, <sense id="n27164.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stage-player, pantomimist</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludiones ex Etruria acciti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludionum oblectamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 4, 18, p. 359, 8</bibl>; cf. 1. ludius, I.</sense></entryFree>
luditor: <entryFree id="n27165" type="gloss" key="lu_di^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūdĭtor</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">diapai/zw</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</entryFree>
ludius: <entryFree id="n27166" type="main" key="lu_di^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūdĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>ludus</etym>. <sense id="n27166.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A stageplayer, pantomimist</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fite caussā meā ludii barbari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse ille maxime ludius, non solum spectator, sed actor et acroama,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:54:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 54, 116</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:chapter=11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 9, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludius aequatam ter pede pulsat humum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triviales ex Circo ludios interponebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:74" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 74</bibl></cit>; cf. ludio.—</sense><sense id="n27166.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A gladiator</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitata est Hippia ludium ad Pharon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:82" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 82</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n27167" type="spur" key="Lu_di^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lūdĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, a false reading for S. Tadius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 37, § 116</bibl>.</entryFree>
ludivagus: <entryFree id="n27168" type="main" key="lu_di^va^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūdĭvăgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ludus-vagus</etym>, <sense id="n27168.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sportive</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Psa. 1, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ludo: <entryFree id="n27169" type="main" key="lu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūdo</orth>, <itype>si, sum</itype> (<sense id="n27169.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> ludier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 3, 16</bibl>), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>root lud- for loid-, from Sanscr. krīd, to play; cf. laus and cluere from Sanscr. root cru-</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to play.</hi> </sense><sense id="n27169.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to play, play at a game</hi> of some kind: <cit><quote lang="la">tesseris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aleā ludere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:23:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 23, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pilā et duodecim scriptis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:50:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 50, 217</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 16, 73</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 62, 253</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum pila,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:20:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 20, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trocho,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nucibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:1:12" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pilā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:8:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">positā luditur arcā,</quote> <trans><tr>with one's whole cash-box staked</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:90" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eburnis quadrigis cotidie in abaco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud quem alea lusum esse dicetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:5:1 praef" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 11, 5, 1 praef.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus consultum vetuit in pecuniam ludere,</quote> <trans><tr>to play for money</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:5:2" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 11, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego nisi quom lusim nil morer ullum lucrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 7, 22</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n27169.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aleam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:70" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">par impar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 248</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducatus et imperia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Trojam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelia latronum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:357" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 357</bibl></cit>; cf. <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt aliis scriptae, quibus alea luditur, artes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:471" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 2, 471</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alea luditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:10" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aleae ludendae causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:5:1 praef" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 11, 5, 1 praef.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alea ludebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:5:1:section=2" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 11, 5, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27169.3" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lusimus per omnes dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:71" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">94</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ludis circensibus elephantos lusisse,</quote> <trans><tr>appeared in the public games</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:18:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 18, 8</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dimittere lusum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:Sat. Men. 53:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> Sat. Men. 53, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27169.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To play, sport, frisk, frolic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum se exornat, nos volo Ludere inter nos,</quote> <trans><tr>have some fun</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludere armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:631" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 631</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suppeditant et campus noster et studia venandi honesta exempla ludendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:29:104" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 29, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad ludendumne, an ad pugnandum, arma sumturi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:20:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 20, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in numerum,</quote> <trans><tr>dance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic juvenum series teneris immixta puellis ludit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:64" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cumque marinae In sicco ludunt fulicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:363" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 363</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in exiguo cymba lacu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:330" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 330</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n27169.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27169.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To sport, play</hi> with any thing, <hi rend="ital">to practise as a pastime, amuse one's self with</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">illa ipsa ludens conjeci in communes locos, Cic. Par. prooem.: Prima Syracosio dignata est ludere versu Nostra ... Thalia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 1</bibl></cit>.—Esp., <hi rend="ital">to play</hi> on an instrument of music, <hi rend="ital">to make</hi> or <hi rend="ital">compose music</hi> or <hi rend="ital">song</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludere quae vellem calamo permisit agresti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">talia fumosi luduntur mense Decembri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:491" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 491</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod tenerae cantent, lusit tua musa, puellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coloni Versibus incomptis ludunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:386" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 386</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina pastorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 565</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid vacui sub umbra Lusimus tecum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 22, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27169.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To sport, dally, wanton</hi> (cf. "amorous play," Milton, P. L. 9, 1045): <cit><quote lang="la">scis solere illam aetatem tali ludo ludere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 2, 36</bibl></cit>: affatim edi, bibi, lusi, Liv. Andron. ap. Paul. ex Fest. s. v. affatim, p. 11 Müll.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lusisti satis, edisti satis, atque bibisti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 214</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:389" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 389</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 207</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:104:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 104, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27169.8" n="C" level="2"> Ludere aliquem or aliquid, <hi rend="ital">to play, mock, imitate, mimic</hi> a person or thing (only in mockery; cf.: partes <cb n="LUDU" /> agere, etc.): civem bonum ludit, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 9, 1</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ludere opus,</quote> <trans><tr>to imitate work, make believe work</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:252" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 252</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magistratum fascibus purpurāque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 260 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludere causas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:1:45" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 1, 45</bibl></cit>: impia dum Phoebi Caesar mendacia ludit, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:70" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 70</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27169.9" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To trifle with</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">summa pericula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:38:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 38, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viribus imperii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 18:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 18, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27169.10" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To spend in play</hi> or <hi rend="ital">amusement, to sport away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">otium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:67:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 67, 9</bibl></cit>.—Hence, ludere operam, <hi rend="ital">to throw away one's labor, to labor in vain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 135</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27169.11" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To make sport</hi> or <hi rend="ital">game of</hi> a person, <hi rend="ital">to ridicule, rally, banter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Domitius in senatu lusit Appium collegam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 15</bibl></cit> a, 13: <cit><quote lang="la">satis jocose aliquem ludere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium irrisione ludi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:12:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 12, 50</bibl></cit>.—Rarely with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput aselli, ad quod lascivi ludebant ruris alumni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:98" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 98</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27169.12" n="G" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To delude, deceive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">auditis, an me ludit amabilis Insania?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:332" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 332</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">custodes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:6:9" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 6, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:7" default="NO">3, 4, 7</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc civili bello, quam multa (haruspicum responsa) luserunt,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>gave wanton, deceptive responses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:24:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 24, 53</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ludor: <entryFree id="n27170" type="hapax" key="lu_dor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūdor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>ludo</etym>, <sense id="n27170.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a player</hi>, Schol. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:105" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 105</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ludus: <entryFree id="n27171" type="main" key="lu_dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūdus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27171.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a play.</hi> </sense><sense id="n27171.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27171.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a play, game, diversion, pastime</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad pilam se aut ad talos, aut ad tessaras conferunt, aut etiam novum sibi aliquem excogitant in otio ludum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:15:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 15, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">datur concessu omnium huic aliqui ludus aetati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:12:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 12, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">campestris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec lusisse pudet, sed non incidere ludum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27171.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n27171.4" n="1" level="3"> Ludi, <hi rend="ital">public games, plays, spectacles, shows, exhibitions</hi>, which were given in honor of the gods, etc. </sense><sense id="n27171.5" n="(a)" level="5"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc praetore ludos Apollini faciente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:20:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 20, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludos committere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludos magnificentissimos apparare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludos apparatissimos magnificentissimosque facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:54:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 54, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludos aspicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:238" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 238</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludos persolvere alicui deo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:330" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 330</bibl></cit>: ludis, <hi rend="ital">during the games</hi>, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 63, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. prol. 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">circus maximus ne diebus quidem ludorum Circensium ... irrigabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aq. 97" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aq. 97</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ultra quid erit, nisi ludus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:199" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 199</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27171.6" n="(b)" level="5"> In this sense, ludi is freq. in appos. with the <hi rend="ital">neutr. plur.</hi> of the <pos>adj.</pos> which names the games: <cit><quote lang="la">ludi Consualia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 9, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludi Cerealia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:39:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 39, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludi Taurilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 22, 1</bibl></cit> (Weissenb. Taurii); 34, 54, 3; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam faciem soloecismi habent ... ut tragoedia Thyestes, ut ludi Floralia ac Megalensia ... numquam aliter a veteribus dicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:52" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 52</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ludis Megalensibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:24:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 24, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27171.7" n="(g)" level="5"> Also with <hi rend="ital">gen. of place</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo ipso die auditam esse eam pugnam ludis Olympiae memoriae proditum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:2:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27171.8" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Stage-plays</hi> (opp. to the games of the circus): <cit><quote lang="la">venationes autem ludosque et cum collegā et separatim edidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27171.9" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A place of exercise</hi> or <hi rend="ital">practice, a school</hi> for elementary instruction and discipline (cf. schola): <cit><quote lang="la">in ludum ire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidicinus,</quote> <trans><tr>music-school</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. prol. 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterarum ludi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludus discendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dionysius Corinthi dicitur ludum aperuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Isocrates, cujus e ludo, tamquam ex equo Trojano, meri principes exierunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:22:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 22, 94</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:42:144" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 42, 144</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladiatores, quos ibi Caesar in ludo habebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 14, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:33:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 33, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterarii paene ista sunt ludi et trivialis scientiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterarium ludum exercere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsides quosdam abductos e litterario ludo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi namque (in foro) in tabernis litterarum ludi erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:44:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 44, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem puerum in ludo cognōrat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Flavī ludum me mittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 72</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:11:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 11, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rhet. 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic veniunt ad miscellanea ludi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:26" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n27171.10" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27171.11" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Play, sport</hi>, i. e. any thing done, as it were, in play, without trouble, <hi rend="ital">mere sport, child's play</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio ludus est homini non hebeti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:17:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 17, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum illa perdiscere ludus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:8:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 8, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus (Graecis) jusjurandum jocus est, testimonium ludus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 5, 12</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n27171.12" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Sport, jest, joke, fun</hi>: si vis videre ludos<pb n="1084" /> <cb n="LUGE" />  jucundissimos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 78</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad honores per ludum et per neglegentiam pervenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:70:section=181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 70, § 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem per ludum et jocum evertere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 60</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">155: amoto quaeramus seria ludo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vertere seria ludo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 226</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil per ludum simulabitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:324" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 324</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ludos facit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 52</bibl></cit>: ludos facere aliquem, <hi rend="ital">to make sport of, make game of, to banter, jeer at, mock</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nunc is te ludos facit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem, senecta aetate, ludos facias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 74</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">miris modis dī ludos faciunt hominibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 4, 2, 46</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludos fieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hocine me aetatis ludos vis factum esse indigne?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 5, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: ludos aliquem dimittere, <hi rend="ital">to send one away with scorn and derision</hi>, or, as in Engl., <hi rend="ital">to send one off with a flea in his ear</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam hercle quisquam me lenonem dixerit, si te non ludos pessimos dimisero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludos facis me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: facere ludos aliquid, <hi rend="ital">to make a jest</hi> or <hi rend="ital">a trifle of any thing, to throw away, to lose</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc et operam ludos facit, et retia, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludos dare, praebere,</quote> <trans><tr>to make one's self ridiculous</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludos alicui reddere,</quote> <trans><tr>to play tricks on</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 3, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: dare ludum alicui, <hi rend="ital">to give play to one</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to humor, indulge</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 10, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. prol. 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 10, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amori dare ludum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: ludus aetatis, <hi rend="ital">the pleasures of love</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si frui liceret ludo aetatis, praesertim recto et legitimo amore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 50</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27171.13" n="C" level="2"> Ludus, <hi rend="ital">the title of a work of Nævius</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut est in Naevii Ludo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 6, 20</bibl></cit>; Fest. s. v. redhostire, p. 270, 22 Müll.—Also, Ludus de Morte Claudii, a work of Seneca.</sense></entryFree>
luella: <entryFree id="n27172" type="hapax" key="lu^ella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭella</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭēla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>luo</etym>, <sense id="n27172.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an expiation, a punishment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelerisque luela Carcer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1015" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1015</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lues: <entryFree id="n27173" type="main" key="lu^es1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭes</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (<case>nom.</case> <orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭis</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Hamart. 250</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Psych. 508</bibl>; old <case>acc.</case> lueruem, i. e. luerem for luem, Carm. Fratr. Arv.), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>akin to <foreign lang="greek">loimo/s</foreign>; Sanscr. root lū, to cut; cf. <foreign lang="greek">luth/r, lu/tron</foreign>, solvo</etym>, <sense id="n27173.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plague, pestilence</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27173.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, Carm. Fratr. Arv.: <cit><quote lang="la">dira lues quondam Latias vitiaverat auras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:626" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 626</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lues et pestifer annus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 139</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:79:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 79, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 199</bibl>; Licin. Macer. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 52, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27173.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27173.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Any spreading evil, common calamity</hi> or <hi rend="ital">misfortune;</hi> of war: <cit><quote lang="la">immensa belli lues,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 15</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of an earthquake,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 47</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of a tempest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 1117" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 1117</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27173.4" n="B" level="2"> As a term of abuse, of whatever has a blighting influence, <hi rend="ital">a plague, pest</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Harusp. Resp. 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">saeva Thebarum lues,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Sphinx</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Phoen. 131" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Phoen. 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa horrida lues,</quote> <trans><tr>of Hannibal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:603" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 603</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dira illa lues,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:622" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 16, 622</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pellere saevam Quondam fata luem dederunt Aquilone creatis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Harpies</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:431" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 431</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n27173.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Decay, corruption</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">morum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 8, § 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n27174" type="main" key="lu^es2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cf. <foreign lang="greek">lu/w</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n27174.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that which is not bound;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">fluid, water not frozen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulo ante lues, jam considenda jacebat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 123</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lugdunum: <entryFree id="n27175" type="main" key="Lugdu_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lugdūnum</orth> (orig. form LVGVDVNVM, v. Rhein. Mus. 1854, vol. 9, p. 445 sq.), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n27175.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Gaul, at the confluence of the Arar and Rhodanus</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Lyons</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 18, 32, § 107</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 65</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 85</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n27175.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lugdūnensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Lugdunum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">colonia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">64</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 91:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 91, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">clades,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ara,</quote> <trans><tr>an altar to Augustus, where Caligula inslituted a prize contest between the Greek and Latin rhetoricians</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:43" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 43</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 20</bibl>: Gallia Lugdunensis, <hi rend="ital">that part of Gaul in which Lugdunum was situated</hi>, also called Gallia Celtica, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 17, 31, § 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:107" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 18, 32, § 107</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 59</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 59</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lugeo: <entryFree id="n27176" type="main" key="lu_ge^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūgĕo</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 2</itype> (luxti for luxisti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:66:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 66, 21</bibl>; <sense id="n27176.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dep.</hi> lugeri, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 1251</bibl>), <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [akin to Gr. <foreign lang="greek">lugro/s, loigo/s</foreign>; Sanscr. root lū, to cut; cf. lues], <hi rend="ital">to mourn, lament, bewail, deplore</hi> (syn. ploro). </sense><sense id="n27176.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27176.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">luget senatus, maeret equester ordo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annum feminis ad lugendum constituere majores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 63:13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 63, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Helv. 16:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cons. ad Helv. 16, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hos pro me lugere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:42:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 42, 101</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sei ad pii rogum fili lugetur. etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:39:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 39, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27176.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: lugere mortem Trebonii, Cic. <cb n="LUMB" /> Phil. 12, 10, 25: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ego nunc lugeam vitam hominum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:Tusc. 1:34:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 34, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occasum atque interitum rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:Pis. 8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ager lugere dominum videretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:Verr. 2:3:18:section=47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 18, § 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matronae annum, ut parentem, eum luxerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 7</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lugebere nobis, Lugebisque alios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parentes et filii majores X annis anno lugendi sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 1, 21, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servus matronis lugendus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:267" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 267</bibl></cit>.—With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem e suis faucibus ereptam esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: in dominos vanas luget abisse minas, Claud. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 2, 4</bibl> prooem.—</sense><sense id="n27176.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lugere formae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:424" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 424</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27176.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be in mourning, to wear mourning apparel</hi> (v. luctus): <cit><quote lang="la">nec lugentibus id facere fas est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui luget, abstinere debet a conviviis, ornamentis et albā veste,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 1, 21, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pullo lugentes vellere lanas,</quote> <trans><tr>fit for mourning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:157" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 157</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lugubre: <entryFree id="n27177" type="main" key="lu_gu_^bre_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūgū^brē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. lugubris <sense id="n27177.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
lugubris: <entryFree id="n27178" type="main" key="lu_gu_^bris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūgū^bris</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">lūgūbris</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:547" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 547</bibl>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lugeo and fero</etym>, <sense id="n27178.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to mourning, mourning-</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27178.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lamentatio,</quote> <trans><tr>over the dead</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:13:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 13, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <trans><tr>mourning apparel</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 45</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">cultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantus,</quote> <trans><tr>a dirge</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 24, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <trans><tr>a house of mourning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genitor,</quote> <trans><tr>mourning, sorrowing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:690" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 690</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">pectora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:10:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 10, 145</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lūgū^brĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">mourning garments, sable weeds</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lugubria indue,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:669" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 669</bibl></cit>; illa dies veniet, mea qua lugubria ponam. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:2:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 2, 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">imposita lugubria numquam exuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Helv. 16:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Helv. 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lugubria sumpsi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 12, 97.— </sense><sense id="n27178.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27178.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">That causes mourning, disastrous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Trojae renascens alite lugubri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3, 61</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27178.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Mournful, doleful, plaintive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:546" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 546</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vagitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 226</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:99" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 99</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n27178.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Mean, pitiable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sagum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:9:28" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 9, 28</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>, in two forms: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lūgū^bre</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">lūgū^brĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">mournfully, dolefully, portentously, plaintively</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cometae Sanguinei lugubre rubent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:273" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 273</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonitu lugubre minaci Mulciber immugit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:140" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lugubriter eiulantes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, 8, p. 132</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lugubriter: <entryFree id="n27179" type="main" key="lu_gu_^bri^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūgū^brĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. lugubris <sense id="n27179.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
luis: <entryFree id="n27180" type="main" key="lu^is"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭis</orth>, v. lues <sense id="n27180.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
luitio: <entryFree id="n27181" type="main" key="lu^i^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>luo</etym>, <sense id="n27181.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a paying, payment</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:15:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 15, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 3, 7</bibl>: de luitione pignoris, <hi rend="ital">the redemption of a pledge</hi> by paying the money lent, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 8, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
luma: <entryFree id="n27182" type="gloss" key="lu_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n27182.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A thorn</hi>: luma genus herbae vel potius spinae, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=120" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 120</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n27182.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of cloak</hi>: luma, sagum quadrum, Glos. Isid.</sense></entryFree>
lumarius: <entryFree id="n27183" type="main" key="lu_ma_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūmārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>luma, I.</etym>, <sense id="n27183.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for thorns</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">falces,</quote> <trans><tr>for cutting down thorns</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=137" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 137</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
lumbago: <entryFree id="n27184" type="gloss" key="lumba_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lumbāgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>lumbus</etym>, <sense id="n27184.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lumbago</hi>: vitium et debilitas lumborum, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=120" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 120</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
lumbare: <entryFree id="n27185" type="main" key="lumba_re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lumbāre</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27185.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an apron for the loins</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Jer. 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 7, 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 22, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lumbellus: <entryFree id="n27186" type="main" key="lumbellus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lumbellus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27186.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little loin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:7:1:section=259" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 7, 1, § 259</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lumbifragium: <entryFree id="n27187" type="hapax" key="lumbi^fra^gi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lumbĭfrăgĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>lumbus-frango</etym>, <sense id="n27187.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a breaking of the loins</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:298" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 298</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lumbricosus: <entryFree id="n27188" type="main" key="lumbri_co_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lumbrīcōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lumbricus</etym>, <sense id="n27188.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of intestinal worms</hi>, Cael. Aur.</sense></entryFree>
lumbricus: <entryFree id="n27189" type="main" key="lumbri_cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lumbrīcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n27189.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an intestinal worm, maw-worm, stomach-worm</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27189.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si teniae et lumbrici molesti erunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 126</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:25" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 25</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:30:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 30, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec lumbricis ulli sunt (oculi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 52, § 140</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 7:8 al" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 7, 8 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n27189.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an earth-worm, dew-worm</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc ab transenna hic turdus lumbricum petit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 6, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">effodere lumbricos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 12</bibl></cit>.—As a term of abuse, <hi rend="ital">thou worm!</hi> foras, lumbrice, qui sub terra erepsisti modo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 4, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lumbulus: <entryFree id="n27190" type="main" key="lumbu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lumbŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>lumbus</etym>, <sense id="n27190.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little loin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 11, 47, § 109</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:7:8:section=292" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 7, 8, § 292</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
