lumbus: <entryFree id="n27191" type="main" key="lumbus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lumbus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n27191.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a loin</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27191.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">At Edepol nos (velimus) tibi in lumbos linguam atque oculos in solum (decidisse),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 1, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exporgi meliust lumbos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:prol. 24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. prol. 24</bibl></cit> (1); <cit><quote lang="la">id. Ep. Grex, 2: lumborum tenus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 82</bibl></cit>: usque ad lumbos, <cb n="LUME" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:131" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 131</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nautaeque caput lumbosque saligno Fuste dolat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aprugnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 57, 78, § 210</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:14" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 3, 8, § 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magno premit populus agmine lumbos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:244" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 244</bibl></cit>.—As food: <cit><quote lang="la">caprigeni lumbi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 9, 12</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">lumbis patris habere se putat digitos grossiores, said of those who regard themselves as superior to their forefathers (cf. 1 Kings, 12, 10),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 82</bibl></cit>, n. 3.—</sense><sense id="n27191.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27191.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The genital organs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:20" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:4:35" default="NO">4, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:59" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 59</bibl>.—Hence, in eccl. Lat.: <cit><quote lang="la">in lumbis patris,</quote> <trans><tr>yet unborn</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Heb. 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reges de lumbis tuis egredientur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:35:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Gen. 35, 11</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n27191.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">That part of a vine from which the branches spring</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arbor. 3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arbor. 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:23:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 23, 35</bibl>, n. 26, § 210.</sense></entryFree>
lumectum: <entryFree id="n27192" type="hapax" key="lu_mectum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūmectum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>luma, I.</etym>, <sense id="n27192.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a thicket of thorns</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumariae (falces) sunt, quibus secant lumecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=137" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 137</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
lumen: <entryFree id="n27193" type="main" key="lu_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>contr. from lucmen, from the root luc; v. luceo</etym>, <sense id="n27193.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">light</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27193.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: quasi lumen de suo lumine accendat, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:16:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 16, 51</bibl> (Fragm. v. 388 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">solis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:42:91" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 42, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabulas bene pictas conlocare in bono lumine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:75:261" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 75, 261</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:9:37" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 9, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumina solis,</quote> <trans><tr>the sunbeams</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 162</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27193.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27193.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A light, a source of light, a lamp, torch</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumine apposito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:36:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 36, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diurnum,</quote> <trans><tr>the morning-star</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:455" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 455</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumini oleum instillare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 11, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luminibus accensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 19, 21, § 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa lumina nocte tuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:10" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 10</bibl></cit> (9), 42.— </sense><sense id="n27193.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Brightness, splendor, gleam</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">ferri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:802" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 802</bibl></cit>; Claud. Cons. Prob. et Olybr. 94.—</sense><sense id="n27193.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A bright color</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): flaventia lumina calthae, Col. poët. 10, 97; 9, 4.—</sense><sense id="n27193.6" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Daylight, day</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): si te secundo lumine hic offendero, Moriere, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:11:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 11, 29</bibl> (Trag. v. 302 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">lumine quarto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:356" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 356</bibl></cit>; cf.: eos hostes, urbes agrosque eorum ... lumine supero privetis, Vet. Form. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 9, 11</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n27193.7" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The light of life, life</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">lumen linque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumine adempto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1033" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1033</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:4:45" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 4, 45</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27193.8" n="6" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The light of the eye, the eye</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">luminibus amissis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:39:114" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 39, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">astantes lumine torvo Aetnaeos fratres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:677" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 677</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fossis lumen abire genis, Ov P. 2, 8, 66: acuentes lumina rutae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 801</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumina defixa tenere in gremio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> H 21, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumina flectere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> M. 5, 232</bibl></cit>: parcite luminibus, <hi rend="ital">close</hi> or <hi rend="ital">turn away the eyes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:33" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 2, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumina sera dextra componere,</quote> <trans><tr>to close one's eyes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:279" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 279</bibl></cit>.—Fig.: <cit><quote lang="la">Romani imperii lumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:52:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 52, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reipublicae lumen et caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:99:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 99, 1</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n27193.9" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The pupil of the eye</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 2, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27193.10" n="7" level="3"> An opening through which light can penetrate, <hi rend="ital">a light</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:168" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 168</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 6</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">An airhole, air-shaft</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 6, 31, § 57</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">A window</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stabula non egeant septentrionis luminibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obserare lumina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2</bibl></cit>, p 125: altius aedes non tollendi, ne luminibus vicini officiatur, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 2, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">immittere lumina,</quote> <trans><tr>to put in windows</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 1, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27193.11" n="8" level="3"> In <hi rend="ital">plur., the light</hi> in a building: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid altius exstruendo, aut arborem ponendo, lumina cujusquam obscuriora fiant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:2:14" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum M. Buculeius aedes L. Fufio venderet, in mancipio lumina, uti tum essent, ita recepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:39:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 39, 179</bibl></cit>.—Hence, se luminibus ejus esse obstructurum, <hi rend="ital">to obstruct the light by building</hi>, Cic. pro Dom. 44, 115.—</sense><sense id="n27193.12" n="9" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The opening</hi> or <hi rend="ital">orifice</hi> in a water-pipe or funnel, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 27" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:29" default="NO">29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:36" default="NO">36</bibl>; 105.—</sense><sense id="n27193.13" n="10" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The light</hi> in pictures, in opp. to the shade: <cit><quote lang="la">invenit lumen atque umbras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 5, 11, § 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:131" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 11, 40, § 131</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27193.14" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27193.15" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A light</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a most distinguished person</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thing, an ornament, glory, luminary</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clarissimis viris interfectis lumina civitatis exstincta sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certis dicendi luminibus ornare orationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:27:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 27, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi, ingenii consiliique tui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:12:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 12, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">probitatis et virtutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:8:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 8, 27</bibl></cit>: est corporis macula, naevus; <cit><quote lang="la">illi tamen hoc lumen videbatur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a beautyspot</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:28:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 28, 79</bibl></cit>: luminibus alicujus obstruere or officere, <hi rend="ital">to obscure one's glory</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reputation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:17:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 17, 66</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27193.16" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Light, clearness, perspicuity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordo est maxime, qui memoriae lumen affert,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:86:353" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 86, 353</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio adhibere lumen rebus debet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 13, 50</bibl></cit>: nunc parvulos nobis dedit (natura) igniculos, quos celeriter ... sic restinguimus,<pb n="1085" /> <cb n="LUNA" />  ut nusquam naturae lumen adpareat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec mentis quasi luminibus officit altitudo fortunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:16:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 16, 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27193.17" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Merit, excellence, beauty</hi> of style: <cit><quote lang="la">Origines (Catonis) quod lumen eloquentiae non habent?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:17:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 17, 66</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so in the pun: Catonis luminibus obstruere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>; cf. I. B. 7. 8. supra.—</sense><sense id="n27193.18" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Ornaments of style</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">at sunt qui haec excitatoria lumina a componendis orationibus excludenda arbitrentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:49" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:29" default="NO">8, 5, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 5, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumina sententiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:202" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 2, 202</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
luminare: <entryFree id="n27194" type="main" key="lu_mi^na_re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūmĭnāre</orth>, <itype>āris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>lumen</etym>, <sense id="n27194.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that whieh gives light, a light-giver</hi> (mostly in <number>plur.</number>). </sense><sense id="n27194.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A luminary, a heavenly body</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fecitque Deus duo luminaria magna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 1, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27194.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A light, lamp</hi>, burned in the Jewish temple and in Christian churches, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:35:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 35, 8</bibl> (cf. lucerna): <cit><quote lang="la">accenduntur luminaria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Vigil. 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27194.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A window-shutter, window</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">luminaria lata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">octavam partem tolli luminarium aedium ad Streniae memineris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:26:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 26, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
luminator: <entryFree id="n27195" type="main" key="lu_mi^na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūmĭnātor</orth>, <itype>oris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>lumino</etym>, <sense id="n27195.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a giver of light</hi> (late Lat.), Aug. c. Faust. Manich. 20, 12.</sense></entryFree>
luminatus: <entryFree id="n27196" type="main" key="lu_mi^na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūmĭnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. lumino.</entryFree>
lumino: <entryFree id="n27197" type="main" key="lu_mi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūmĭno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>lumen</etym>, <sense id="n27197.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to light up, brighten, illumine</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tu luminas solem, regis mundum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 269, 40</bibl></cit>: tellus floribus luminata, Marc. Cap. 1, § 27; <cit><quote lang="la">§ 66: locus fenestris luminatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:9" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 9</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">lūmĭ-nātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P a.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">male luminatus,</quote> <trans><tr>short-sighted</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 222, 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
luminosus: <entryFree id="n27198" type="main" key="lu_mi^no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūmĭnōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27198.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of light, light, luminous</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27198.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedificia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum luminosius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 137" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 137 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n27198.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">bright, conspicuous, prominent, remarkable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">partes orationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:36:125" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 36, 125</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">luminosissima caritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 144" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 144</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
luna: <entryFree id="n27199" type="main" key="lu_na1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (<sense id="n27199.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> lunai, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 69</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>contr. for luc-na, from root luc; v. luceo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">the moon</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27199.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dimidiata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extrema et prima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:37" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solis annuos cursus spatiis menstruis luna consequitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:19:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 19, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 40, 103</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 39, 123</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum luna laboret,</quote> <trans><tr>is eclipsed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:38:92" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 38, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lunae defectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lunae defectio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:47" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">siderum regina bicornis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:35" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> C. S. 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:448" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 448</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nivea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:367" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 367</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dimidia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:323" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 32, 75, § 323</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 30, 36, § 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nova,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:322" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 32, 75, § 322</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intermenstrua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:322" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 32, 75, § 322</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lunae senium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 48, 49, § 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lunae coitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 39, 74, § 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crescens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decrescens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 5</bibl></cit>: tertia, quarta, quinta, etc., <hi rend="ital">the third, fourth, fifth</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">day after the new moon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">laborans,</quote> <trans><tr>an eclipse of the moon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:442" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 442</bibl></cit>: corniculata, dividua, protumida, plena, App. de Deo Socr.—</sense><sense id="n27199.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27199.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A month</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">centesima revolvente se luna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 25, 57, § 217</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:531" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 531</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27199.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A night</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">roscida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:337" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 337</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immeritae omnia lunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:4:23" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 4, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27199.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The figure of a half-moon, a crescent, lune</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:289" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 289</bibl>. —Esp., <hi rend="ital">the badge worn by senators on their shoes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">felix ... appositam nigrae lunam subtexit alutae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:191" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patricia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:2:27" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 2, 27</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 34</bibl>, and lunula. —</sense><sense id="n27199.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The semicircular cartilages in the throat</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 7, 191</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27199.7" n="E" level="2"> Personified: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lūna</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the Moon-goddess</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Volcanus, Luna, Sol, Dies, di quattuor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:374" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 374</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">19, 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:299" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 299</bibl> sqq.; <cit><quote lang="la">Hyg. Fab. praef.: Aristoteles ... Minervam esse lunam probabilibus argumentis explicat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 31</bibl></cit>. Her temple, built on the Aventine by Servius Tullius, was burned in Nero's reign, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 41</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n27200" type="main" key="Lu_na2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lūna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n27200.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Etruria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Luni</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 8, § 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 21, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:11" default="NO" valid="yes">43, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:30:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 30, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:482" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 482</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n27200.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lūnensis</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lūniensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Luna</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caseus Luniensis, remarkable for its size,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:241" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 42, 97, § 241</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:30" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 30</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">marmor,</quote> <trans><tr>the modern marble of Carrara</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 6, 7, § 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 18, 29, § 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ara,</quote> <trans><tr>an altar of marble of Luna</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:50" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 50</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lūnenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Luna</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 14</bibl>. <cb n="LUPA" /></sense></entryFree>
lunaris: <entryFree id="n27201" type="main" key="lu_na_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūnāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. luna</etym>, <sense id="n27201.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the moon, lunar</hi>.—<usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:37" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> L. L. 9, § 26</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">cursus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:16" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 39, 74, § 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:296" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 296</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lunaticus: <entryFree id="n27202" type="main" key="lu_na_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūnātĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n27202.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Living on the moon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 23, 13</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n27202.1" n="II" level="1"> = <foreign lang="greek">selhniako/s, selhno/plhktos</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">epileptic, lunatic, moon-struck, crazy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mancipium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:43:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 43, § 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 4, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">17, 14</bibl>; Acron. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:454" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 454</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 64, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculus,</quote> <trans><tr>that is blind at certain times, blind in moonlight</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 2, 18</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lūnātĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a crazy person, lunatic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lunaticus est et male patitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:17:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 17, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lunatus: <entryFree id="n27203" type="main" key="lu_na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. luno.</entryFree>
lunchus: <entryFree id="n27204" type="main" key="lunchus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lunchus</orth>, v. lonchus.</entryFree>
lunensis: <entryFree id="n27205" type="main" key="Lu_nensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lūnensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. 2, Luna, II.</entryFree>
luno: <entryFree id="n27206" type="main" key="lu_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>1. luna</etym>, <sense id="n27206.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bend like a half-moon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">crescent, to crook like a sickle</hi> (rare in the <hi rend="ital">verb. finit.;</hi> freq. in the <pos>P. a.</pos>): <cit><quote lang="la">lunavit fortiter arcum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acies geminos in arcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 6, 25.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">lūnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., half-moon-shaped, crescent-shaped, lunated, falcated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Amazonidum peltae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:490" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 490</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lunata/ fronte juvenci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:265" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 265</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lunatis obliquatur cornibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 13, 15, § 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conchae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 33, 52, § 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferramentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:54" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 54</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <hi rend="ital">bearing a crescent; marked with something of a crescent shape</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lunatum agmen,</quote> <trans><tr>a line of battle with shields of crescent shape</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:145" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 145</bibl></cit>: pellis, <hi rend="ital">a senator's shoe</hi> (v. luna, I. 3.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:49:31" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 49, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lunula: <entryFree id="n27207" type="main" key="lu_nu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūnŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>1. luna</etym>, <sense id="n27207.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little moon</hi>, an ornament worn by women: <cit><quote lang="la">aurea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lunulae sunt ornamenta mulierum in similitudinem lunae, bullulae aureae dependentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 31, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cult. Fem. 2, 10</bibl>.—Rarely of the luna worn by senators on their shoes: hac lunula nam adsuta calceis discernuntur patricii a noviciis, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:192" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 192</bibl>; cf. luna, II. C.</sense></entryFree>
lunus: <entryFree id="n27208" type="main" key="Lu_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lūnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>luceo</etym>, <sense id="n27208.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Moon-god</hi>, worshipped at Carræ, <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Caracall. 6, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
luo: <entryFree id="n27209" type="main" key="lu^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭo</orth>, <itype>lui, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>root lu-, to wash; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">lou/w, loutro/n</foreign>; cf. <foreign lang="greek">lu=ma, lu/qron</foreign>, polluo, diluo, and lavo</etym>, <sense id="n27209.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to wash, lave.</hi>—<usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graecia luitur Ionio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:22" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 22</bibl></cit>: amnis moenia luit, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 3, 190.—</sense><sense id="n27209.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to cleanse, purge</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insontes errore luit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:407" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 407</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n27210" type="main" key="lu^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭo</orth>, <itype>lui</itype> (no <sense id="n27210.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>, but <hi rend="ital">fut. part. act.</hi> luiturus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 5, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> VI. Cons. Hon. 140</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 535</bibl>; v. Neue, Formenl. 2, p. 585), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>root lu, to loose, let go; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">lu/w</foreign>; cf. <foreign lang="greek">luth/r, lu/tron</foreign>; Lat. solvo, reluo; Germ. los; Engl. loose; prob. not connected with luo, 1.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to loose, let go, set free.</hi>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n27210.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To release from debt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundum a testatore obligatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:1:78:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 36, 1, 78, § 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27210.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To pay</hi> a debt or penalty: <cit><quote lang="la">aes alienum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:2:25" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">debitum, Cod. Th. 2, 4, 3: cautum est ut lueret in singulas (arbores caesas) aeris XXV.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 1, 1, § 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27210.3" n="C" level="2"> Luere poenas or poenam, <hi rend="ital">to suffer</hi> as a punishment, <hi rend="ital">undergo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque mei peccati luo poenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad luendas rei publicae poenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:27:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 27, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui Tuscā pulsus ab urbe Exsilium dirā poenam pro caede luebat,</quote> <trans><tr>was undergoing banishment as a punishment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:624" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 624</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">augurium malis,</quote> <trans><tr>to suffer the misfortune which the augury predicted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 8, 6, § 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplicia crucibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:5:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 5, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27210.4" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To atone for, expiate</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">stuprum voluntariā morte luere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:22:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 22, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noxam pecuniā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (obsides) capite luerent, si pacto non staretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguine perjuria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:502" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 502</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commissa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 454</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27210.5" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To satisfy, appease</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">libidinem alicujus sanguine innocentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:30:section=77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 30, § 77</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27210.6" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To avert by expiation</hi> or <hi rend="ital">punishment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pericula publica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:28:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 28, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">responsa,</quote> <trans><tr>to render void, of no effect</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:569" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 569</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lupa: <entryFree id="n27211" type="main" key="lu^pa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭpa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>lupus</etym>, <sense id="n27211.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a she-wolf</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27211.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">rabidae tradis ovile lupae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 4, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab agro rava decurrens lupa Lanuvino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 27, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem nutrit dura papilla lupae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:5:4:54" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 5, 4, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lupa Romuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:5" default="NO">3, 7, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27211.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27211.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A prostitute, vile woman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3</bibl>, <cb n="LUPI" /> 3, 22: <cit><quote lang="la">ille, qui semper secum scorta, sem per exoletos, semper lupas ducebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:21:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 21, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 4, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus grata est pictā lupa barbara mitrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:66" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Orig. Gent. Rom. 21:1" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Orig. Gent. Rom. 21, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lupa, id est meretrix,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 19</bibl></cit>.—In a pun with the literal meaning, I. supra: <cit><quote lang="la">nam ovis illius hau longe absunt a lupis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:3:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 3, 1, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27211.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a dog</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:12:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 12, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lupanar: <entryFree id="n27212" type="main" key="lu^pa_nar"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭpānar</orth>, <itype>āris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>lupa, II. A.</etym>, <sense id="n27212.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a house of ill-repute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui in lupanari accubat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deprehensus in lupanari cum alienā uxore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:121" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virorum, Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 5, 3, 2.—As a term of reproach: O lutum, lupanar, aut si perditius potest quid esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:42:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 42, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lupanaris: <entryFree id="n27213" type="main" key="lu^pa_na_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭpānāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lupanar</etym>, <sense id="n27213.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">belonging to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">characteristic of a lewd woman</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infamia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 229, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lupanarium: <entryFree id="n27214" type="main" key="lu^pa_na_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭpānārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, i. q. lupanar, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:3:27 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 5, 3, 27 al.</bibl></entryFree>
lupanus: <entryFree id="n27215" type="main" key="lu^pa_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭpānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lupa</etym>, <sense id="n27215.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lewd</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">feminae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Commod.</author> 59, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lupariae: <entryFree id="n27216" type="main" key="lu^pa_ri^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭpārĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n27216.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">brothels</hi>, Sext. <bibl default="NO"><author>Ruf.</author> Reg. 2</bibl>; Inscr. ap. Gud. 33, 1.</sense></entryFree>
luparius: <entryFree id="n27217" type="main" key="lu^pa_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭpārĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>lupus</etym>, <sense id="n27217.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wolf-hunter</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 1, 139</bibl>; cf.: luparius, <foreign lang="greek">lukoqh/ras</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
lupatus: <entryFree id="n27218" type="main" key="lu^pa_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭpātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27218.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">furnished with wolf's teeth</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">iron prickles</hi> shaped like a wolf's teeth. </sense><sense id="n27218.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gallia nec lupatis Temperet ora frenis,</quote> <trans><tr>curbs studded with jagged points</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 8, 6</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n27218.2" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> (sc. freni or frena): <orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭpāti</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭpāta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a curb armed with sharp teeth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equus adeo sprevit lupatos, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duris parere lupatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 208</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">asper equus duris contunditur ora lupatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurea lupata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:105:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 105, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
luperca: <entryFree id="n27219" type="main" key="Lu^perca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lŭperca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>v. Lupercus</etym>, <sense id="n27219.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a goddess of the old Romans, the wife of</hi> Lupercus, <hi rend="ital">identified with the deified she-wolf that suckled Romulus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 128</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lupercal: <entryFree id="n27220" type="main" key="Lu^percal"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lŭpercal</orth>, <itype>ālis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Lupercalis</etym>, <sense id="n27220.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a grotto on the Palatine Hill, sacred to the Lycean Pan (Lupercus)</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gelidā monstrat sub rupe Lupercal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:342" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 342</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. Serv. ad loc.: quamquam Velia non est vilior quam Lupercal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 20, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forsitan et quaeras cur sit locus ille Lupercal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:381" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 381</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n27220.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lŭpercālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Lupercalia, Lupercal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27220.2" n="B" level="2"> Hence, <number>plur.</number> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lŭpercālĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum and ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the festival of the Lycean Pan (Lupercus), celebrated in February, in which the priests</hi> (Luperci), <hi rend="ital">with their faces painted and only a girdle about their loins</hi> (cinctuti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:101" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 101</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">ran about the city striking the women whom they met, a ceremony supposed to make them fruitful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Lupercalia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:34:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 34, 87</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 33, 84</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hodierni diei res gestas Lupercalibus habebis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 13, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:267" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 267</bibl> sqq.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 8, 343</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lupercus: <entryFree id="n27221" type="main" key="Lu^percus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lŭpercus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>lupus, and perh. arceo</etym>. <sense id="n27221.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The Roman name of the Lycean Pan</hi> (so called because he protected the flocks from wolves), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:3:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 4, 3, 1</bibl>.—Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n27221.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A priest of the Lycean Pan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nudi Luperci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:663" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 663</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:267" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 267</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec prodest agili palmas praebere Luperco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:142" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 142</bibl></cit>. There were at first two classes of these priests, the Fabiani and the Quintiliani, to whom afterwards, in honor of Cæsar, were added the Juliani, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:76" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 76</bibl>. At first the priests were chosen only from the herdsmen, but afterwards young persons of the highest rank were received among them: <cit><quote lang="la">ita eras Lupercus, ut te consulem esse meminisse deberes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:34:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 34, 85</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 31</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">There were also Luperci at Velitrae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lupia: <entryFree id="n27222" type="main" key="Lupi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lupĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Luppia</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n27222.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in the north-west of Germany</hi>, now the <hi rend="ital">Lippe</hi>, Mela, 3, 3, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:10:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 10, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 60</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 5, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lupiae: <entryFree id="n27223" type="main" key="Lu_^pi^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lū^pĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n27223.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">plur., a town of Calabria</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> 30, 85</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lupicinus: <entryFree id="n27224" type="main" key="Lu^pi^ci_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lŭpĭcīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n27224.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a man</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Petr.</author> Vit. S. Mart. 1, 369</bibl>. <pb n="1086" /> <cb n="LUPU" /></sense></entryFree>
lupillus: <entryFree id="n27225" type="hapax" key="lu^pillus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭpillus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>2. lupinus</etym>, <sense id="n27225.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small lupine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lupinaceus: <entryFree id="n27226" type="main" key="lu^pi_na_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭpīnācĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27226.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">made of lupines</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lomentum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lupinarius: <entryFree id="n27227" type="main" key="lu^pi_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭpīnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27227.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for lupines</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">labrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 10</bibl></cit> and 11.— </sense><sense id="n27227.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭpīnārĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">dealers in lupines</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 33, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lupinus: <entryFree id="n27228" type="main" key="lu^pi_nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭpīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lupus</etym>, <sense id="n27228.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a wolf, wolf's</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 10, 20: <cit><quote lang="la">pellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 19, 78, § 257</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27228.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">like a wolf</hi>: impetus, Enn. ap. Don. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 2, 25</bibl> (Sat. v. 28 Vahl.): rictus, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 2, 98.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n27229" type="main" key="lu^pi_nus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭpīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭpīnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n27229.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lupine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi lupinum bonum fiet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 34, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:10:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 10, 1 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 14, 36, § 133</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 6, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 3, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fetus viciae tristisque lupini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunicam mihi malo lupini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:153" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 153</bibl></cit>. —Esp., since, on the stage, lupines were used as mock-money, prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec tamen ignorat quid distent aera lupinis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: <hi rend="ital">Ag.</hi> Agite, inspicite. <hi rend="ital">Co.</hi> Aurum est, profecto, spectatores, comicum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 2, 20</bibl>; cf. also: si quis sub specie alearum victus sit lupinis vel alia quavis materia, Cod. 3, 43, 1.</sense></entryFree>
lupodunum: <entryFree id="n27230" type="main" key="Lu_po^du_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lūpŏdūnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n27230.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a German town near the sources of the Danube</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Ladenburg</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Lupff</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Mosell. 423</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lupor: <entryFree id="n27231" type="main" key="lu^por"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭpor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n27231.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [lupa, II.], <hi rend="ital">to associate with lewd women</hi>: cum meretrice per vias lupantur, Atta ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 133, 11</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 3 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">impune lupari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:ib. 15" default="NO"><author>Lucil.</author> ib. 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lupula: <entryFree id="n27232" type="main" key="lu^pu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭpŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27232.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little she-wolf</hi>, transf., <hi rend="ital">a witch, hag</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 164, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lupus: <entryFree id="n27233" type="main" key="lu^pus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭpus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>kindred with <foreign lang="greek">lu/kos</foreign>; Sanscr. vrika, and our wolf</etym>, <sense id="n27233.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wolf</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27233.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">torva leaena lupum sequitur, lupus ipse capellam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 63, 88, § 173</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:80" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 22, 34, § 80</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Martialis lupus,</quote> <trans><tr>sacred to Mars</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:17:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 17, 9</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Martius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:566" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 566</bibl></cit>: lupus femina for lupa, <hi rend="ital">a she-wolf</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 2, 355</bibl> (Ann. v. 70 Vahl.); id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 378, 18</bibl> (<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> v. 73</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">lupus masculinum (est), quamquam Varro ... lupum feminam dicit, Ennium Pictoremque Fabium secutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 12</bibl></cit>.—According to the belief of the Romans, if a wolf saw a man before the latter saw him, the man became dumb: vox quoque Moerim Jam fugit ipsa; <cit><quote lang="la">lupi Moerim videre priores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 53</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 22, 34, § 80</bibl>.—Prov.: lupus in fabulā or sermone, said of the appearance of a person when he is spoken of; as we say in English, <hi rend="ital">talk of the devil, and he appears</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque eccum tibi lupum in sermone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 1, 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 1, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. E. 9, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de Varrone loquebamur: lupus in fabulā: venit enim ad me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:33:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 33, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27233.2" n="(b)" level="5"> Lupum auribus tenere, <hi rend="ital">to have a wolf by the ears</hi>, to be unable to hold and afraid to let go, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be in a situation of doubt and difficulty</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 2, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27233.3" n="(g)" level="5"> Hac urget lupus, hac canis angit, <hi rend="ital">on this side the wolf, on that the dog</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be placed between two fires</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 64</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27233.4" n="(d)" level="5"> Lupos apud oves custodes relinquere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ovem lupo committere,</quote> <trans><tr>to intrust sheep to a wolf</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 1, 16</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">o praeclarum custodem ovium, ut aiunt, lupum!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 11, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">plenum montano credis ovile lupo?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:363" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 363</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) Lupo agnum eripere, of a difficult undertaking; <cit><quote lang="la">as in English,</quote> <trans><tr>to snatch the meat from a dog's mouth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:5:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 5, 31</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) Lupus observavit, dum dormitaret canes, of one who watches his opportunity to be unobserved, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 133</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) Ovīs ultro fugiat lupus, of a very improbable act, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 52</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">q</foreign>) Tantum curamus frigora, quantum numerum (ovium) lupus, i. e. do not care at all, <hi rend="ital">as the wolf does not care whether the number of the sheep is right or not</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 51</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27233.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27233.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A voracious fish, the wolf-fish</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pike</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 54, 79, § 169</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:61" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 17, 28, § 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:89" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 89</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 12</bibl> bis.—</sense><sense id="n27233.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of spider</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 4, 27, § 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:80" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 24, 28, § 80</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27233.8" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A bit armed with points like wolves' teeth</hi> (frena lupata): <cit><quote lang="la">et placido duros (equus) accipit ore lupos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:6:3" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 6, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,003:1:281" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Ach. 1, 281</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27233.9" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A hook</hi> with <cb n="LUSC" /> which things were hoisted: <cit><quote lang="la">in alios lupi superne ferrei injecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 23, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27233.10" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A small handsaw</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 43, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27233.11" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The hop, a plant</hi> (Humulus lupulus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 15, 50, § 86</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n27234" type="main" key="Lu^pus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lŭpus</orth>, <sense id="n27234.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname in the</hi> gens Rutilia, e. g. P. Lutilius Lupus, <hi rend="ital">a rhetorician in the time of Augustus;</hi> v. Rutilius; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:23:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 23, 63</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lura: <entryFree id="n27235" type="main" key="lu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūra</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">lōra</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>from same root as lorum, q. v.</etym>, prop. <sense id="n27235.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a thong;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">the mouth of a skin</hi> or <hi rend="ital">leathern bag</hi>, which was closed by a thong: lura os cullei vel etiam utris: unde lurcones capacis gulae homines et bonorum suorum consumptores, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=120" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 120</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27235.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a skin, leathern sack</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Perioch. Odyss. 10</bibl> (In Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:21:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 21, 48</bibl>, Fischer conjectures furi, v. h. l.).</sense></entryFree>
lurchinabundus: <entryFree id="n27236" type="main" key="lurchi^na_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lurchĭnābundus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">lurcĭnābun-dus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">lurchābundus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. lurco</etym>, <sense id="n27236.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">voracious</hi>, Cat. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:42" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 42</bibl>; cf. Spald. ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
lurco: <entryFree id="n27237" type="main" key="lurco1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lurco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">lurcor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n27237.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [perh. lura, to have a stomach of leather], <hi rend="ital">to eat voraciously, to devour</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lurcare est cum aviditate cibum sumere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 10, 31</bibl></cit>: lardum, Pomp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 11, 6</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 169 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut lurcaretur lardum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:ib. 11:2" default="NO"><author>Lucil.</author> ib. 11, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n27238" type="main" key="lurco2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lurco</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">lurcho</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 6, 4</bibl>; Prob. p. 1455 P.), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n27238.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gormandizer, glutton</hi>.—<usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lurco, edax, furax, fugax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 3, 16</bibl></cit>: vivite lurcones, comedones, vivite ventres, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 11, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lastaurum et lurconem et nebulonem popinonemque appellans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 15</bibl></cit>: lurcones capacis gulae homines et bonorum suorum consumptores, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=120" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 120</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n27239" type="main" key="Lurco3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lurco</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n27239.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>. Esp., <hi rend="ital">M. Aufidius, who was the first to fatten peacocks for the table</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:6:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 20, 23, § 45</bibl>.—So of M. Perpenna Lurco, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 237, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27239.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a voluptuary, debauchee</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 213, 6</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n27239.2" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lurcōnĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Lurco, Lurconian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apiciana et Lurconiana condimenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
luridatus: <entryFree id="n27240" type="main" key="lu_ri^da_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūrĭdātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n27240.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj</hi> [luridus], <hi rend="ital">besmeared, defiled</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
luridus: <entryFree id="n27241" type="main" key="lu_ri^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūrĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>luror</etym>, <sense id="n27241.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pale yellow, sallow, wan, ghastly, lurid</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27241.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: luridi supra modum pallidi, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=120" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 120</bibl>; cf.: luridus, <foreign lang="greek">w)xro/s, pe/lios, i)kteriko/s, u(pw/pios</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.: <cit><quote lang="la">luridus Orcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pallor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:267" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 267</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:13:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 13, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95</bibl></cit>; cf.: viden tu illi maculari corpus maculis luridis, *<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 790" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 790</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27241.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">that renders pale</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ghastly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">horror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 198</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aconita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:147" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:560" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 560</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
luror: <entryFree id="n27242" type="main" key="lu_ror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūror</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>etym. dub.; cf.: pullus, lividus</etym>, <sense id="n27242.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a yellowish color, sallowness, paleness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:308" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 308</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">luror permanat in herbas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 3, 238</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lurore buxeo foedatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 222, 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
luscinia: <entryFree id="n27243" type="main" key="lusci^ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">luscĭnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">luscĭnĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 18, 2</bibl> and 11; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 76:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 76, 7</bibl>; and, † <orth extent="full" lang="la">luscĭnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">a)hdw/n</foreign>, Gloss. Lat. Gr.) [for clus-cinia; Sanscr. root cru, to hear; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">klu/w</foreign>; Lat. clueo, to be famous, akin to gloria and cano; <sense id="n27243.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">hence, the melodious or glorious songstress],</quote> <trans><tr>the nightingale</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:81 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 29, 43, § 81 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luscinias soliti impenso prandere coëmptas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:245" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 245</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox luscinii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 76:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 76, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lusciniola: <entryFree id="n27244" type="main" key="lusci^ni^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">luscĭnĭŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>luscinia</etym>, <sense id="n27244.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little nightingale</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aves cantrices, ut lusciniolae ac merulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:14" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> L. L. 5, § 76</bibl> Müll.—Prov.: <hi rend="ital">So.</hi> Pol magis metuo mihi in monendo ne defuerit optio. <hi rend="ital">Ba.</hi> Pol ego metuo lusciniolae ne defuerit cantio, of one who possesses a thing in superabundance, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 4</bibl> Fleck.</sense></entryFree>
luscinius: <entryFree id="n27245" type="main" key="lusci^ni^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">luscĭnĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n27245.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a nightingale;</hi> v. luscinia <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n27246" type="main" key="lusci^ni^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">luscĭnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>luscinus</etym>, <sense id="n27246.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">blinded, one-eyed</hi>, applied by Commodus to persons one of whose eyes he had destroyed, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Commod. 10, 6</bibl>; cf. the foll. art.</sense></entryFree>
luscinus: <entryFree id="n27247" type="main" key="lusci^nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">luscĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>luscus</etym>, <sense id="n27247.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">oneeyed; plur.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">luscĭni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one-eyed persons</hi>: qui altero lumine orbi <cb n="LUSO" /> nascerentur, Coclites vocabantur, qui par vis utrisque Ocellae; <cit><quote lang="la">Luscini injuriae cognomen habuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 55, § 150</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n27248" type="main" key="Lusci^nus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Luscĭnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n27248.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Fabricius Luscinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:3:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 42</bibl> and 43; 37, 4.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n27249" type="main" key="lusci^nus3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">luscĭnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. luscinia <sense id="n27249.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
lusciosus: <entryFree id="n27250" type="main" key="lusci^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">luscĭōsus</orth>, v luscitiosus.</entryFree>
luscitio: <entryFree id="n27251" type="gloss" key="lusci^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">luscĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>luscus</etym>, <sense id="n27251.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dimness of sight</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:10:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 10, § 4</bibl>: vitium oculorum, quod clarius vesperi quam meridie cernit, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=120:17" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 120, 17</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
