luscitiosus: <entryFree id="n27252" type="main" key="lusci^ti^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">luscĭtĭōsus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">luscĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>i. e. luscitionosus, from luscitio</etym>, <sense id="n27252.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that cannot see in the dusk or by lamp-light, dim-sighted, purblind: Pa.</hi> Quid jam? <hi rend="ital">Sce.</hi> Quia luscitiosus. <hi rend="ital">Pa.</hi> Verbero, edepol tu quidem caecus, non luscitiosus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:51 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 51 sq.</bibl> Lorenz ad loc.: vesperi non videre, quos appellant lusciosos, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 135, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">edepol idem caecus non lusciosus est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: luscitiosus qui vespere nihil videt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 10, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lusciosos nyctalopas a Graecis dictos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 11, 47, § 170</bibl></cit>: luscitiosos dici voluerunt interdiu parum videntes, quos Graeci <foreign lang="greek">mu/wpas</foreign> vocant, Fulgent. Expos. Serm. Ant. p. 561 Merc. (Gerlach, p. 391, luscitios).</sense></entryFree>
luscitius: <entryFree id="n27253" type="main" key="lusci^ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">luscĭtĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. luscitiosus <sense id="n27253.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
luscus: <entryFree id="n27254" type="main" key="luscus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">luscus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>root luc of lux; with fundamental idea to glimmer; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">lugh</foreign>, gloom</etym>, <sense id="n27254.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one-eyed: Le.</hi> Oculum ego ecfodiam tibi, si verbum addideris. <hi rend="ital">Sc.</hi> Hercle qui dicam tamen: <cit><quote lang="la">nam si sic non licebit, luscus dixero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Appius cenabo, inquit, apud te, huic lusco, familiari meo C. Sestio: uni enim locum esse video,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:60:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 60, 246</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:65" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 65</bibl>; Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 3, 214</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Gaetula ducem portaret belua luscum (of Hannibal),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:157" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambos perdidit ille oculos, et luscis invidet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:228" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 228</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">with one eye shut</hi>, i. e. taking aim, said mockingly of a statue: <cit><quote lang="la">statua meditatur proelia lusca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:128" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 128</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">half-blind</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:37:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 37, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lusio: <entryFree id="n27255" type="main" key="lu_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ludo</etym>, <sense id="n27255.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a playing, play</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ludum discendi, non lusionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pueri lusionibus vel laboriosis delectantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:20:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 20, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ipsā lusione (pilae),</quote> <trans><tr>in the act of playing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:16:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 16, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pilaris lusio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4 praef" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4 praef.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
lusitania: <entryFree id="n27256" type="main" key="Lu_si^ta_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lūsĭtānĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n27256.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the western part of Spain</hi>, the mod. <hi rend="ital">Portugal</hi> and a part of the Spanish provinces of <hi rend="ital">Estremadura</hi> and <hi rend="ital">Toledo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:38:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 38, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:43:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 43, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:20" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:6:3 sq" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 6, 3 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:1:6" default="NO">3, 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:6:2" default="NO">3, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Ep. 52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Ep. 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 21, 35, § 113</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lū-sĭtānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Lusitania, Lusitanian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cerasa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 25, 30, § 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 1</bibl></cit>, n. 5.—In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lūsĭtāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Lusitanians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:23:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 23, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:46" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 46</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 22, 35, § 116</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lusito: <entryFree id="n27257" type="main" key="lu_si^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūsĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n27257.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> [ludo], <hi rend="ital">to play often</hi> or <hi rend="ital">habitually</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">aut coturnices dantur, quibuscum lusitent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alea festiva et honesta lusitabamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:13:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: in labellis morsicatim, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 139, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lusius: <entryFree id="n27258" type="main" key="Lusi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lusĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n27258.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river of Arcadia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:22:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 22, 57</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lusor: <entryFree id="n27259" type="main" key="lu_sor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūsor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>ludo</etym>, <sense id="n27259.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who plays</hi> at a game; <hi rend="ital">a player</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27259.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic ne perdiderit, non cessat perdere lusor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:1:451" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 1, 451</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:17:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 17, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">furtum factum domi et eo tempore quo alea ludebatur, licet lusor non fuerit qui quid eorum fecerit, impune fit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:5:1:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 11, 5, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> transf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum lusore catello,</quote> <trans><tr>a playful little dog</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:611" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 611</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27259.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27259.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A humorous writer</hi>: tenerorum lusor amorum, Ov Tr. 4, 10, 1.—</sense><sense id="n27259.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A banterer, mocker</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">te ut deludam contra, lusorem meum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 62</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lusorie: <entryFree id="n27260" type="main" key="lu_so_ri^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūsōrĭē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> v. lusorius <sense id="n27260.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
lusorius: <entryFree id="n27261" type="main" key="lu_so_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūsōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lusor</etym>, <sense id="n27261.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a player</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27261.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pila,</quote> <trans><tr>a playing-ball</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 205</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alveus cum tesseris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 2, 6, § 13</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n27261.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lūsōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a place where shows of gladiators and wild beasts were given</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuit sibi triclinium in summo lusorio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Mort. Persecut. 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27261.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Used for pleasure;</hi> hence, as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lūsōrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. navis), <hi rend="ital">a</hi> <pb n="1087" /> <cb n="LUST" /> <hi rend="ital">vessel for pleasure, yacht</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:20:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 20, 3</bibl>; and, transf., <hi rend="ital">any kind of light vessel, cutter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lusoriis navibus discurrere flumen ultro citroque,</quote> <trans><tr>with cruisers</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lusoriae,</quote> <trans><tr>swift-sailing cruisers, cutters</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Bonos. 15</bibl></cit>: de lusoriis Danubii, Cod. Th. 7, tit. 17.—</sense><sense id="n27261.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27261.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">That serves for amusement</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pastime, sportive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 53, 54, § 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 117:25" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 117, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectaculum non fidele et lusorium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 80:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 80, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27261.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">that is done</hi> or <hi rend="ital">given in play;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">empty, ineffectual, invalid</hi>, = irritus: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:8:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 5, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lusorias minas alicui facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:3:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 35, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:8:1" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 43, 8, 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lūsōrĭē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">playfully, in sport, not in earnest, apparently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lusorie (causam) agens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:1:50:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 30, 1, 50, § 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lustrabilis: <entryFree id="n27262" type="gloss" key="lustra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lustrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lustro</etym>, <sense id="n27262.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">conspicuous</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">peri/bleptos</foreign> (i. e. spectabilis), Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
lustrago: <entryFree id="n27263" type="main" key="lustra_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lustrāgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perh. from lustrum</etym>, <sense id="n27263.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant, also called</hi> verbenaca, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lustralis: <entryFree id="n27264" type="main" key="lustra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lustrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. lustrum</etym>, <sense id="n27264.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">relating to purification from guilt</hi> or <hi rend="ital">the appeasing of the gods, lustral</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27264.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrificium,</quote> <trans><tr>a sacrifice of purification, a propitiatory offering</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <trans><tr>lustral water, holy water</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:2:73" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 2, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 304 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vota,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:414" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 414</bibl></cit>: caput, <hi rend="ital">atoning</hi> (of Iphigenia), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 163" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 163</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27264.2" n="II" level="1"> [V. 2. lustrum.] <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a period of five years, quinquennial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">certamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 4</bibl></cit>: aurum, <hi rend="ital">a tax levied every five years on petty shopkeepers, usurers, and brothel-keepers</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">AVRI LVSTRALIS COACTOR,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 347, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collatio, Cod. Th. 13, tit. 1: census Romae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Regul. 1, 8</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lustrālis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the collector of this tax</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> p. 426</bibl>, n. 458.</sense></entryFree>
lustramen: <entryFree id="n27265" type="main" key="lustra_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lustrāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>lustro</etym>, <sense id="n27265.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a means of purification</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:442" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 442</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:409" default="NO">409</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lustramentum: <entryFree id="n27266" type="main" key="lustra_mentum1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lustrāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27266.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a means of purification</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> in Psa. 118</bibl>, Serm. 8.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n27267" type="main" key="lustra_mentum2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lustrāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>lustror</etym>, <sense id="n27267.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an incentive to lust</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis lustramenti causā dederit cantharides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:8:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 8, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lustratio: <entryFree id="n27268" type="main" key="lustra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lustrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>lustro</etym>, <sense id="n27268.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a purification by sacrifice, a lustration</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27268.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lustrationis sacro peracto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 13, 2</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:22:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 22, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27268.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> [v. lustro, II.], <hi rend="ital">a going</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wandering about</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lustrationesque (ferarum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:27:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 27, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">municipiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:23:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 23, 57</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lustrator: <entryFree id="n27269" type="main" key="lustra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lustrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n27269.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A purifier, cleanser</hi>: Gallus sacerdos ac lustrator, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:542" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 542</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27269.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A wanderer through</hi> a place, <hi rend="ital">a traverser</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hercules lustrator orbis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 288, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lustricus: <entryFree id="n27270" type="main" key="lustri^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lustrĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. lustrum</etym>, <sense id="n27270.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to purification</hi>: dies, <hi rend="ital">the eighth</hi> (or <hi rend="ital">ninth</hi>) <hi rend="ital">day after a child's birth, on which it was purified by a sacrifice and received a name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 102</bibl>; cf.: lustrici dies infantium appellantur, puellarum octavus, puerorum nonus, qui his lustrantur atque eis nomina imponuntur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=120" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 120</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
lustrificus: <entryFree id="n27271" type="hapax" key="lustri^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lustrĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. lustrumfacio</etym>, <sense id="n27271.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">purifying</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:448" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 448</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lustro: <entryFree id="n27272" type="main" key="lustro1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lustro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>2. lustrum</etym>, <sense id="n27272.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to purify by means of a propitiatory offering</hi> (syn.: procuro, expio). </sense><sense id="n27272.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrum lustrare sic oportet. Impera suovetaurilia circumagi, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in lustranda colonia ab eo, qui eam deduceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:45:102" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 45, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi instructum exercitum omnem suovetaurilibus lustravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:6" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc vitula innumeros lustrabat caesa juvencos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:25" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 25</bibl></cit> (31 Müll.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem taedis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 2, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terque senem flammā, ter aquā, ter sulphure lustrat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 261</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 231</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lustramurque Iovi votisque incendimus aras,</quote> <trans><tr>we purify ourselves</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 279</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se centum lustrare ovis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:518" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 518</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lustrari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:157" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 157</bibl></cit>: non inveniatur in te, qui lustret filium tuum aut filiam tuam, nec divinus, Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 15, 1, 1.—</sense><sense id="n27272.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, because, at the lustral sacrifice, the priest went around the person or object purified; hence, </sense><sense id="n27272.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To go around, encircle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regem choreis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 224</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n27272.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To go round, wander over, traverse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pythagoras et Aegyptum lustravit et Persarum Magos adiit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:29:87" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 29, 87</bibl></cit>: latitudinem<cb n="LUST" />  lustrans signiferi orbis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:20:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 20, 53</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et salis Ausonii lustrandum navibus aequor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:385" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 385</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pede barbaro Lustrata Rhodope,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:25:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 25, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lustrati montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 27, 31, § 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla meis frustra lustrantur compita plantis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:15:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lustravitque fuga mediam gladiator harenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:14:4" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 14, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:582" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 582</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27272.5" n="C" level="2"> Military term, <hi rend="ital">to review</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum lustravi apud Iconium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 20, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:52" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 52</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inclusas animas superumque ad lumen ituras Lustrabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:681" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 681</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27272.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To review, survey, observe, examine</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">et totum lustrabat lumine corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">respicio et quae sit me circum copia lustro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 564</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus vestigia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 763</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> Sat. 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:787" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 787</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27272.7" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to review, consider</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia ratione animoque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:17:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 17, 57</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27272.8" n="E" level="2"> (Of the sun, moon, etc.) <hi rend="ital">To illuminate, make bright</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">postera Phoebeā lustrabat lampade terras Aurora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 148</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol, obliquo terras et caelum lumine lustrans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:693" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 693</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:79" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 79</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mundi magnum templum Sol et luna suo lustrantes lumine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1437" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1437</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:737" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 737</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sol, qui terrarum flammis opera omnia lustras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:607" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 607</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n27273" type="hapax" key="lustro2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lustro</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, i. q. vagus, <sense id="n27273.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wanderer, vagabond</hi>, Naev. in Lex. Vatic. tom. 8, p. 313; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Klussman,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0112,001:page=232" default="NO"><author>Naev.</author> p. 232</bibl></cit>, and Com. Rel. v. 118 sq. Rib.</sense></entryFree>
lustror: <entryFree id="n27274" type="main" key="lustror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lustror</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n27274.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [1. lustrum], <hi rend="ital">to frequent places of ill-repute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">circum oppida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:Sat. 30:68" default="NO"><author>Lucil.</author> Sat. 30, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lustrantur, comedunt quod habent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi fuisti, ubi lustratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lustrum: <entryFree id="n27275" type="main" key="lustrum1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lustrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>1. luo, lavo; cf.: monstrum, moneo</etym>, <sense id="n27275.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a slough, bog, morass, puddle</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27275.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">prodigunt in lutosos limites ac lustra, ut volutentur in luto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27275.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27275.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A haunt</hi> or <hi rend="ital">den of wild beasts</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lustra ferarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:471" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 471</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:647" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 647</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lustra horrida monstris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:370" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 370</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27275.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A wood, forest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam altos ventum in montes atque invia lustra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter horrentia lustra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 570</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27275.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A house of ill-repute</hi>: ubi in lustra jacuisti? <hi rend="ital">St.</hi> Egone in lustra? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod dem scortis, quodque in lustris comedim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 91</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 22</bibl>: in lustris latet, Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 333, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in lustris, popinis, alea, vino tempus aetatis omne consumpsisses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:11:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 11, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo emersus ex diuturnis tenebris lustrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 9, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27275.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Debauchery;</hi> cf.: lustra significant lacunas lutosas, quae sunt in silvis aprorum cubilia. A quā similitudine, hi, qui in locis abditis et sorditis ventri et gulae operam dant, dicuntur in lustris vitam agere, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=120" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 120</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus, in qua lustra, libidines, luxuries, omnia denique inaudita vitia, versentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:23:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 23, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studere lustris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lustris perire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vino lustrisque confectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui pugnent, marcere Campana luxuria, vino et scortis omnibusque lustris per totam hiemem confectos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:45:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 45, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n27276" type="main" key="lustrum2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lustrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>2. luo</etym>, <sense id="n27276.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a purificatory sacrifice, expiatory offering, lustration</hi>, made by the censors for the whole people once in five years, after completing the census, and in which a swine, a sheep, and a bull were offered (suovetaurilia): lustrum condere, <hi rend="ital">to make the lustral sacrifice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lustrum condidit et taurum immolavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:66:268" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 66, 268</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">censu perfecto edixit, ut omnes cives Romani in campo primā luce adessent. Ibi exercitum omnem suovetaurilibus lustravit: idque conditum lustrum appellatum, quia is censendo finis factus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 24</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:36" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:10" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 10</bibl>. The census could also be taken without being followed by a lustrum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 22, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:43:4" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 43, 4</bibl>: sub lustrum censeri, <hi rend="ital">at the close of the census, when the</hi> lustrum <hi rend="ital">should begin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub lustrum censeri, germani negotiatoris est (because these were usually not in Rome, and were included in the census last of all),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:18:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 18, 8</bibl></cit>.—Being a religious ceremonial, the lustrum was sometimes omitted, when circumstances seemed to forbid it: <cit><quote lang="la">census actus eo anno: lustrum propter Capitolium captum, consulem occisum, condi religiosum fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 22, 1</bibl></cit>. Hence in part, doubtless, must be explained the small number of lustra actually celebrated; <cb n="LUTE" /> thus, A. U. C. 296: <cit><quote lang="la">census perficitur, idque lustrum ab origine urbis decimum conditum ferunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:24:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 24, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27276.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27276.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A propitiatory offering</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quinto die Delphis Apollini pro me exercitibusque et classibus lustra sacrificavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:41:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 41, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27276.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A period of five years, a lustrum</hi> (because every five years a lustrum was performed). </sense><sense id="n27276.4" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus octavum trepidavit aetas Claudere lustrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 4, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:10:78" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 10, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:38:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 38, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27276.5" n="2" level="3"> As the period of taxation, in reference to the imposition of duties, Varr, L. L. 6, 2, 11: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc ipso lustro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superioris lustri reliqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 13, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27276.6" n="C" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a period of several years;</hi> of <hi rend="ital">four years</hi> (of the Julian calendar), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:163" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 163</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 47, 47, § 122</bibl>: ingens lustrum, <hi rend="ital">the grand lustrum, a hundred years</hi>, at the end of which the ludi saeculares were celebrated, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:1:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 1, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27276.7" n="D" level="2"> From the time of Domitian, <hi rend="ital">the Capitoline games</hi>, recurring every fifth year, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> de Die Nat. 18</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:2:60" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 2, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">certamine Jovis Capitolini lustro sexto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 332, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">called lustri certamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 27:7" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 27, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27276.8" n="E" level="2"> Hectoris Lustra (not Lytra), <hi rend="ital">title of a tragedy of Ennius;</hi> v. Trag. Rel. p. 28 sq. Rib.; Vahl. <bibl default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> p. 113 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n27276.9" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The term of a lease</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">priore lustro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:37:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 37, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lusus: <entryFree id="n27277" type="main" key="lu_sus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from ludo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n27278" type="main" key="lu_sus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūsus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>ludo</etym>, <sense id="n27278.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a playing, play, game</hi> (not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n27278.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgineis exercent lusibus undas Naides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:556" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 556</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aleae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec me offenderit lusus in pueris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 3, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 1, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eburneas litterarum formas in lusum offerre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ediscere inter lusum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in lusu duodecim scriptorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnum lusu sortiri,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>by throwing dice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solent quidam et cogere ad lusum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:5:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 11, 5, 2</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n27278.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27278.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Play, sport, game (that is done by way of amusement)</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fas est et carmine remitti, non dico continuo ac longo, sed hoc arguto et brevi. Lusus vocantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 9, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Trojae lusum exhibuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27278.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Sportive dalliance, toying</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt apti lusibus anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 3, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:10:9" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 10, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27278.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Jest, fun, mockery</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dant de se respondentibus venustissimos lusus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>make themselves ridiculous</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:46" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lusum ludere aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:13:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 13, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lutamentum: <entryFree id="n27279" type="hapax" key="lu^ta_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭtāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>1. luto</etym>, <sense id="n27279.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that which is made of mud</hi> or <hi rend="ital">clay, a mud</hi> or <hi rend="ital">clay wall</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 128</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lutarius: <entryFree id="n27280" type="main" key="lu^ta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭtārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. lutum</etym>, <sense id="n27280.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">be longing to mud</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27280.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Living in mud</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">testudines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 4, 14, § 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27280.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Living on mud</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mullus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 17, 30, § 65</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lutatius: <entryFree id="n27281" type="main" key="Lu^ta_ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lŭtātĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Luctātĭus</orth>), <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n27281.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens. So, Q. Lutatius Catulus, <hi rend="ital">consul</hi> A. U. C. 652, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:17:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 17, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:29:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 29, 70</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">a younger man of the same name, consul</hi> A. U. C. 676, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 10, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:15:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 15, 34</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n27281.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lŭtātĭānus (Luct-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Lutatius, Lutatian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:1:12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 1, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lutea: <entryFree id="n27282" type="spur" key="lu_te^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūtĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. lutum</etym>, a false reading for uvam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 5, 26, § 87</bibl>.</entryFree>
lutensis: <entryFree id="n27283" type="hapax" key="lu^tensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭtensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. lutum</etym>, <sense id="n27283.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">found</hi> or <hi rend="ital">living in mud</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus purpurarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 37, 61, § 131</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
luteolus: <entryFree id="n27284" type="main" key="lu_te^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūtĕŏlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n27284.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [1. luteus], <hi rend="ital">yellowish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mollia luteolā pingit vaccinia calthā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">violae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:4:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">olivae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:47:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 47, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
luter: <entryFree id="n27285" type="greek" key="lu_te_r"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūtēr</orth>, <itype>ēris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">louth/r</foreign>, <sense id="n27285.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hand-basin, laver</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Jov. 1</bibl>, n. 20; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 7, 26</bibl> al.</sense></entryFree>
lutesco: <entryFree id="n27286" type="main" key="lu^tesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭtesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n27286.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [2. lutum], <hi rend="ital">to turn to mud, become muddy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litora, quae limo caenoque lutescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 17, 9</bibl></cit>: cava terra lutescit, Furius Antias ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 11</bibl>; id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 133, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lutetia: <entryFree id="n27287" type="main" key="Luteti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lutetĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n27287.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in</hi> Gallia Lugdunensis, now <hi rend="ital">Paris</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 57</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 11, 3 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also Lutetia Parisiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
luteum: <entryFree id="n27288" type="main" key="lu_te^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūtĕum</orth>, v. 1. luteus, II. A.</entryFree>
luteus: <entryFree id="n27289" type="main" key="lu_te^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūtĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. lutum</etym>, prop. <sense id="n27289.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the yellow-weed;</hi> hence, in gen., <hi rend="ital">of the color of lutum</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27289.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Golden-yellow, saffron-yellow, orange-yellow</hi>. chrysocolla, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 5, 27, § 91</bibl>; Varr. ap <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 549, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pallor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:10:16" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 10, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pal la,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:46" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 46</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lūtĕum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <hi rend="ital">n</hi>, <pb n="1088" /> <cb n="LUTU" /> <hi rend="ital">yellow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">color in luteum inclinatus,</quote> <trans><tr>towards yellow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 15, 86, § 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">color in luteum languescens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 13, 109, § 133</bibl></cit>.— Esp., <hi rend="ital">the yolk of an egg</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lutea ex ovis quinque columbarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 15, 49, § 141</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n27289.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Flame-colored</hi>, of the veil of a bride (v. flammeus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:361" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 361</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 8, 22, § 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27289.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Rose-colored</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rosa ... sese pandit in calyces medio sui stantis conplexa luteos apices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 4, 10, § 14</bibl></cit>: Aurora in roseis fulgebat lutea bigis ( = crocea; cf. <foreign lang="greek">kroko/peplos</foreign>, Hom. Il. 8, 1), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">me Lutea mane videt pulsis Aurora tenebris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:703" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 703</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13, 579</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Memnonis in roseis lutea mater equis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:714" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 714</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Anthol. Lat.</author> 5, 7, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n27290" type="main" key="lu^te^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭtĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. lutum</etym>, <sense id="n27290.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of mud</hi> or <hi rend="ital">clay</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27290.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">defingit Rheni luteum caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus,</quote> <trans><tr>of a swallow's nest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:157" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedificium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:56:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57</bibl></cit>. § <cit><quote lang="la">194: toreuma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:46:16" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 46, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Adam</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 3, 41</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n27290.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27290.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Bemired, muddy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gallina si sit luteis pedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 11, 28, § 93</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n27290.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Besmeared, bedaubed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">luteum ceromate corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:47:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 47, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vulcanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:132" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 132</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27290.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">dirty, vile, worthless</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">blitea et lutea meretrix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:14:section=35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 14, § 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotium,</quote> <trans><tr>a sorry commodity, poor affair</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 14</bibl></cit>, § 32.</sense></entryFree>
lutito: <entryFree id="n27291" type="hapax" key="lu_ti^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūtĭto</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>1. luto</etym>, <sense id="n27291.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bedaub;</hi> only trop., <hi rend="ital">to bring into contempt, to asperse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam hi mores majorum laudant, eosdem lutitant quos conlaudant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 15</bibl></cit> Brix ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
luto: <entryFree id="n27292" type="main" key="lu^to1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>2. lutum</etym>, <sense id="n27292.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bedaub with mud</hi> or <hi rend="ital">clay</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27292.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 92</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nidosque reversa lutabit hirundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:5:17" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lutati tituli statuarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Elag. 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27292.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to bedaub, besmear</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne lutet immundum nitidos ceroma capillos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:50:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 50, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crassis lutatus amomis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:104" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 104</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n27293" type="hapax" key="lu_to2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>for luito, from luo; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=116:5" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 116, 5</bibl> Müll.: litatum ... quasi luitatum</etym>, <sense id="n27293.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pay</hi>: lutavi, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 131, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lutor: <entryFree id="n27294" type="gloss" key="lu_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>luo</etym>, <sense id="n27294.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a washer, fuller</hi>: ‡ lutor, <foreign lang="greek">plu/ths h(liasth/s</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Gud.</author> 17, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lutosus: <entryFree id="n27295" type="main" key="lu^to_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭtōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. lutum</etym>, <sense id="n27295.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of mud</hi> or <hi rend="ital">loam, muddy, miry, dirty</hi>: terra, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 19, 49, § 176</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:45" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rapa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 54</bibl></cit> (56), 1.</sense></entryFree>
lutra: <entryFree id="n27296" type="main" key="lu_tra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūtra</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">lȳtra</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>luo</etym>, <sense id="n27296.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an otter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 30, 47, § 109</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:144" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 11, 53, § 144</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">form lytra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=79" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 79</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
lutulente: <entryFree id="n27297" type="main" key="lu^tu^lente_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭtŭlentē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. lutulentus <sense id="n27297.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
lutulentus: <entryFree id="n27298" type="main" key="lu^tu^lentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭtŭlentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. lutum</etym>, <sense id="n27298.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">muddy</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27298.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sus,</quote> <trans><tr>bedaubed with mud</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diluvio tellus lutulenta recenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:434" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 434</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:6:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 6, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:23:13" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 23, 13</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n27298.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">besmeared</hi> with ointment: <cit><quote lang="la">et putri lutulenta de palaestra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:67:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 67, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27298.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27298.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Filthy, dirty, vile</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lenone istoc non lutum est lutulentius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scio ego, multos jam lucrum lutulentos homines reddidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lutulente Caesonine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 12, 27</bibl></cit>: persona illa lutulenta, impura. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 7, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui vexat lutulentā balnea turbā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:131" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 131</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27298.5" n="B" level="2"> Of style, <hi rend="ital">muddy, turbid, impure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Lucilius) cum flueret lutulentus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at dixi fluere hunc lutulentum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 10, 50</bibl></cit>.—Hence, * <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭtŭlentē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">impurely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lotiolente dictum velut lutulente,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 131, 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lutulo: <entryFree id="n27299" type="hapax" key="lu^tu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭtŭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27299.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bespatter with mud;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">to asperse;</hi> old reading, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 15</bibl>; for lutito, q. v., cf. Ritschl, Prol. ad Plaut. p. lxxiv.</sense></entryFree>
lutum: <entryFree id="n27300" type="main" key="lu_tum1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lūtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n27300.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant used in dyeing yellow, yellow-weed. dyer's-weed, weld</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam croceo mutabit vellera luto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 5, 26, § 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27300.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a yellow color, yellow</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cir. 316</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimius luto corpora tingit amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:9" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 9</bibl></cit> (8), 52 Heyne ad loc.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n27301" type="main" key="lu^tum2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭtus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, Quadrig. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 212, 17</bibl>) [luo], <sense id="n27301.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mud, mire</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27301.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">volutari in luto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:24:section=53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 24, § 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cratesque luto integuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 15</bibl></cit>; Quadrig. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 212, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">imbre lutoque Aspersus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 11, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luto perfusa porticus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:66" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 66</bibl></cit>: pinguia crura luto, id. <cb n="LUX" /> 3, 247: <cit><quote lang="la">luto opplere aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in longa via et pulvis et lutum et pluvia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 96:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 96, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis aliquem luto obliniverit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te pervolvam in luto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 4, 38</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: luta et limum aggerebant, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 212, 16</bibl>.—Prov.: in luto esse or haerere, <hi rend="ital">to stick in the mud</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be at a dead stop, unable to proceed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc homo in medio luto est: Nomen nescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque mihi haud imperito eveniet, tali ut in luto haeream,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eodem haesitas luto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 2, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 8, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 2, 3</bibl>: pro luto esse, <hi rend="ital">to be as cheap as dirt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro luto erat annona,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia pro luto habere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 67, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 51, 6</bibl>.—As a term of reproach, <hi rend="ital">mud, filth</hi>: ludis me. <hi rend="ital">Pa.</hi> Tum mihi sunt manus inquinatae. <hi rend="ital">Sc.</hi> Quidum? <hi rend="ital">Pa.</hi> Quia ludo luto, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 5, 2, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lutum lenonium, commictum caeno stercilinum publicum!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 3, 5, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:42:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 42, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">O tenebrae, o lutum, o sordes,</quote> <trans><tr>offscouring of the earth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:26:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 26, 62</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27301.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27301.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Loam, clay, potter's clay</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pocula de facili luto componere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:40" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficta Saguntino cymbia malo luto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:6:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: quibus arte benigna Et meliore luto finxit praecordia Titan, <hi rend="ital">of better clay</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of better materials</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:34" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 34</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:23" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines compositi luto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:13" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27301.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The dust with which wrestlers besprinkled themselves</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 88:18" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 88, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lutus: <entryFree id="n27302" type="main" key="lu^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lŭtus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. 2. lutum <sense id="n27302.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
lux: <entryFree id="n27303" type="main" key="lux"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lux</orth>, <itype>lūcis</itype> (adverb. <case>abl.</case> luce, luci, and lucu, and in these old forms also used as <gen>m.</gen>; <sense id="n27303.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>; in Plaut. lux is usually <gen>m.</gen>; Brix ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 4, 11</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>luceo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">light</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27303.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27303.2" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">the light of the sun and other heavenly bodies</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum id solis luce videatur clarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:37:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 37, 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per umbras Stella facem ducens multā cum luce cucurrit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:694" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 694</bibl></cit>: a lucifero donec lux occidat, <hi rend="ital">till sunset</hi>, Juv, 13, 158. —<hi rend="ital">The light, splendor, brightness of shining bodies</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">viridi cum luce zmaragdi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luce coruscus ahenā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:470" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 470</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucem non fundentes gemmae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 7, 25, § 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:124" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 124</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27303.3" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">the light of day, daylight, day</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">diurna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:848" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 848</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Metellus cum primā luce in campum currebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante lucem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:64:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 64, 259</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primā luce ad eum accurrit,</quote> <trans><tr>at daybreak, dawn of day</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luce sub ipsā,</quote> <trans><tr>on the very verge of day</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:490" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 490</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in luci,</quote> <trans><tr>by day</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 233</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luce reversā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:312" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 312</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n27303.4" n="b" level="4"> In <case>abl.</case> adverb.: luce, luci, and (ante-class.) lucu, <hi rend="ital">by daylight, in the daytime</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut luce palam in foro saltet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:24:93" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 24, 93</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">luce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 10, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 36, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:153 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 153 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocte ac luce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:43" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut veniamus luci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum luci simul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luci claro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:10:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 10, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 210, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis audeat luci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 10, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quodsi luce quoque canes latrent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:20:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 20, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 4, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum primo lucu ibo hinc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum primo luci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 49</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27303.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27303.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The heavenly bodies</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illae, quae fulgent luces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=96" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 96</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27303.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A day</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">centesima lux est ab interitu P. Clodii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:35:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 35, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longiore luce ad id certamen nobis opus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anxia nocte, anxia luce gemit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:806" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 806</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crastina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 244</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natali die mihi dulcior haec lux,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:1" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">septima quaeque lux,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:105" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 105</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">natura volvente vices et lucis et anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:88" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 88</bibl></cit>. —Hence, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lux aestiva,</quote> <trans><tr>summer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lux brumalis,</quote> <trans><tr>winter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:11:39" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 11, 39</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27303.8" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Life</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ab Orco mortuom me reducem in lucem feceris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora luce carentum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of the dead</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 255</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:473" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 473</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">simul atque editi in lucem sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27303.9" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An eye, the eyesight</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">effossae squalent vestigia lucis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:585" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 585</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">damnum lucis ademptae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 197</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27303.10" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A light</hi>, of an eminent man to whom all eyes turn: <cit><quote lang="la">Luce nihil gestum, nihil est Diomede remoto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 100</bibl></cit>.—Of a beloved person: <cit><quote lang="la">o lux salve candida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 34</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n27303.11" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27303.12" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The sight of all men, the public view, the public, the world</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero ille in luce modo, atque in oculis civium magnus sed intus domique praestantior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:4:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 4, 12</bibl></cit>: Isocrates forensi luce caruit, <cb n="LUXU" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:8:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 8, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">familiam abjectam et obscu ram e tenebris in lucem vocare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 11, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res occultas aperire in lucemque proferre,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 19, 62</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27303.13" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Light, encouragement, help, succor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lux quaedam videbatur oblata, non modo regno, sed etiam regni timore sublato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civibus lucem ingenii et consilii porrigere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:40:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 40, 184</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lucem adferre rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Manil. 12, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27303.14" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A light, an ornament</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc urbem, lucem orbis terrarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus sine luce,</quote> <trans><tr>undistinguished, obscure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:248" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 248</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27303.15" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Light, illustration, elucidation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">historia testis temporum, lux veritatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:9:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 9, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27303.16" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">That which enlightens, the source of illumination</hi>: ratio quasi quaedam lux lumenque vitae. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 8, 26</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ego sum lux mundi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> John, 8, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
